title: Financial Analyst
job_description:
SUMMARY:Growing, central Houston wealth management firm seeks operations and planning analyst/CFP due to growth

DESCRIPTION:

Our client is a boutique wealth management and advisory firm in Houston. After a decade on Wall Street, the owners escaped to open their own private money management and planning firm. They have grown uninterrupted ever since. This firm has 3 primary service offerings for their clients: Financial Planning, Investment Management and Personal Advice for their clients. They successfully do all three effectively and efficiently with zero client attrition.

This firm is stable, growing and is a safe harbor for great people based on their successful track record and retention rates for both clients and staff. This firm has done well despite the pandemic and energy crisis without external or government assistance, and is growing organically. They are looking to grow their team.

Due to their growth and success, they are expanding some of their service offerings and they have an opportunity to expand one part of their business in a meaningful way, which has created a need to add a new team member. This person will be an integral part of the back office and client facing management of the firm, and will assist with growth related to this side of their practice. This role will be responsible for operations management and will assist with planning for clients as well. This role will not be a sales role but will assist in managing existing relationships and new clients. This is a diverse role that will evolve over time and will have numerous opportunities and paths for growth. This is a special and unique opportunity to grow with an established and successful company where the sky is the limit!

Job Requirements:

REQUIREMENTS:

4 year degree in Finance, Accounting, CFP or other business discipline strongly preferred, but experience in this industry will be considered if the education component is different.

Financial planning experience strong preferred

Financial analysis experience required

Strong Excel skills required

Strong client management ability as well as a customer service focus required

3+ years experience in a financial services environment. Life Insurance company experience desirable

Series licenses desirable but not required

CFP or CFA preferred

Desire to grow professionally and to take on new challenges required

title: Marketing Analyst
job_description:
Top 3 reasons our employees love working at Omicron:

We build cutting-edge technology that is literally changing how the world consumes online content.
We get to collaborate with really smart, interesting people every day.
Omicron rewards its team with really fun company events. Past events include food trucks on-site for lunch, private movie screenings, tickets to charity galas and more!

JOB SUMMARY:

We are looking for a Marketing Analyst to assist in the ongoing development of our Integrated Marketing Department. We create compelling, user-centric and targeted content for an international consumer base who are interested in security and privacy products. In collaboration with department leaders, you will drive innovation and standards for all aspects of website content for 11+ digital properties.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Compile and analyze performance reports for online campaigns.

Work closely with team members both local and remote to meet tight deadlines.
Dig deep into campaign performance data to identify opportunities for improvement.
Assist on the production of regular strategy reports.

Keep abreast of current SEO white hat and black hat tactics.
Assist in the implementation of off-page SEO content strategies.
Work with internal and external partners to support SERP rank and linking strategies.
Assist in the execution of SEO best practices.
Research additional content opportunities to help grow our businesses.
Review and analyze our sites for areas that need to be improved, deleted or revised.
Work with the Conversions Manager to design and implement data driven site optimizations.

REQUIRED PERSONAL SKILLS:

Strong organizational and project management skills with the ability to work both independently and as part of a team on multiple projects.
Strong interpersonal, written and oral communication skills.
Strong attention to detail.
Ability to take initiative in solving team problems.
Experience in the ability to present complex data to peers.
Strong customer service and interpersonal skills.
Sense of urgency in responding promptly to client and internal requests.
Strong interest in learning about digital media.
Comfortable working several projects at once.
Creative thinking within a set of guidelines.
English: Fluent

ADDITIONAL SKILLS:

Advanced knowledge in Google Adwords, Bing Ads and/or other search engine marketing (SEM) programs preferred.
Working knowledge of popular SEO tools (Raven Tools, Moz Analytics, Buzzstream, etc.).
Working knowledge of databases including writing SQL queries is preferred.
Understanding of Analytics and Content Strategy in a retail/consumer focused sales environment.
Highly Proficient in MS Excel, PowerPoint and Word.
Experience with HTML, CSS.
Social marketing experience.
Proven collaboration and team building skills.

EDUCATION:

Bachelor's Degree in business, marketing, communications or related subjects. MBA preferred.

title: 2021 Investment Banking - Summer Analyst Program - Sydney/Melbourne
job_description: Spend your summer working alongside the top professionals in the business to come up with solutions that shape the global economy. Our bankers are focused on long-term relationships and developing strategies that help our government, institutional and corporate clients grow and innovate. We do this by providing sound advice, helping them access funds and making connections, all while helping clients manage the many risks in today's complex environment.Our industry and product teams work together to develop and execute strategies that help our clients grow and achieve their objectives in today's global markets. Our industry and product teams include: Debt Capital Markets, Energy & Utilities, Equity Capital Markets, Financial Institutions, Financial Sponsors, General Industrials, Metals & Mining, Real Estate.Working here means joining a collaborative, supportive team. We want your diverse perspective to help us innovate the next wave of products and solutions for our clients. We'll give you what you need to succeed from training to mentoring from senior leaders to projects that engage all your skills.**WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT**Our nine-week program kicks off with orientation and training, giving you technical and practical skills. Top performers may receive a Full Time offer at the end of the summer.You'll make an impact by:• Analyzing market data, building detailed financial models and preparing client presentations for mergers and acquisitions, leveraged buyouts and capital markets advisory• Managing client transactions from pitch to close under the guidance of our senior leaders• Coming up with innovative and creative ways to solve complex, real-world business challenges• Learning how we help clients and communities grow, no matter their needs,• Sharpening your technical skills• Building your professional network with mentors, senior executives and others**ABOUT YOU**If you've got initiative and the vision to come up with strategies and plans, then this is the role for you.Key skills include:• Excellent analytical, quantitative and interpretative skills• Ability to thrive in a dynamic, collaborative work environment• Being adaptable, flexible and resilient• Knowing your way around Excel, PowerPoint and Word• Fluency in English• Coursework in finance or economics a plus• Expected graduation date of May 2021- December 2021• Minimum required cumulative GPA of 3.2 on a 4.0 scale• You must be an Australian citizen or already have been granted Permanent Residency at the time of application**WHAT'S NEXT?**Help us learn about you by submitting a complete and thoughtful application, which includes your resume. Your application and resume is a way for us to initially get to know you, so it's important to complete all relevant application questions so we have as much information about you as possible.To start the application, you will be prompted to enter your email address. Your email address will be used to create and maintain your profile so make sure it is one you will have long term access to. Do not use an email address with ".edu" extension as doing so could result in delays receiving updates regarding your candidacy.After you confirm your application, we will review it to determine whether you meet certain required qualifications. Please make sure you indicate in your application what is your preferred location (Sydney or Melbourne).If you are advanced to the next step of the process, you'll receive an email invitation to complete a series of 12 games through the pymetrics platform. Pymetrics will allow you to showcase your potential beyond what you tell us in your resume and application form. It's an additional data point that helps us gain a better understanding of who you are as an individual. It should take no longer than 25-35 minutes to complete. If you have already completed the pymetrics games, you will have the opportunity to submit your gameplay results for this specific application without having to replay the games.Following completion of pymetrics, you'll receive another email invitation to complete a video interview, powered by HireVue. This is your opportunity to further bring your resume to life and showcase your experience for our recruiting team and hiring managers.Both pymetrics and HireVue are required, and your application will not be considered for further review until you have completed them. We strongly encourage that you apply and complete these required elements as soon as possible, since programs will close as positions are filled.**APPLICATION DEADLINE**If applying for a Melbourne placement - applications will close on **14 July, 2020** .If applying for a Sydney placement - applications will close on **25 July, 2020** .*Application deadline is 12:00pm AESTWe encourage you to apply as early as possible so your application can be considered.For enquiries, please email us at aus.grad@jpmorgan.com .Visit jpmorgan.com/careers for upcoming events, career advice, our locations and more.JPMorgan Chase is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that respects all people for their unique skills, backgrounds and professional experiences. title: Financial Analyst
job_description:
General Summary/Purpose:

The Johns Hopkins Biomedical Engineering (BME) is an interdisciplinary department with 8 affiliated centers and institutes that are part of a joint collaboration effort between the Whiting School of Engineering (WSE) and the School of Medicine (SOM). The Department's mission is to improve health through excellence in research and education at the interface of engineering, biology, and medicine.

The Financial Analyst (FA), reporting to the Financial Manager, leads budgeting and finance activities for the Department of Biomedical Engineering. The FA will perform analysis and projections relating to business or research trends, oversee the development and monitoring of departmental non-sponsored, discretionary and sponsored budgets, plan and determine costs of business activities; recommend budget adjustments and other cost improvement measures and close out terminated grants and contracts, transfer funding and produce summary documents. This position will also ensure that all funding is received and that expenditures do not exceed revenue, develop financial planning and cost analysis reports, meet with faculty to review and ensure compliance with university and/or agency regulations and restrictions, and perform comprehensive financial analysis to improve departmental financial effectiveness and compliance with JHU and/or agency regulations and restrictions.

Note: This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship.

Specific Duties and Responsibilities:

I. Grant Management:

Manages post-award process including but not limited to allocation of budgets
Coordinates the timely and accurate set up of payroll per grant guidelines
Processes journal entries and cost transfers as needed, reconciling reports, and research related payroll and financial data
Facilitates and/or produces specialized sponsored research/project reports utilizing institutional and/or departmental systems)
Provides guidance and oversight that grant/contract funds remain in compliance with University and award/contractual guidelines, including recommendations to ensure all sponsored awards are reconciled and balanced without a surplus or deficient balance
Acts as key contact for Shared Services Sponsored Projects as part of the grant/contract fiscal reporting processes including the grant/contract closeout and Financial Status Reporting process
Acts as key contributor in the annual budgeting process by providing research salary and support information. Ensures that salaries are not on control salary and that all research salary support for faculty and staff is cleared from the departmental default account monthly
Provides monthly, periodic and/or ad-hoc financial reporting as requested by Faculty
Ensures proper management of all sponsored awards, by insuring all financial transactions agree with GAAP, NIH Grants Policy Statement, FDP, OMB, CAS, and University
Reviews of effort reports and payroll prior to release to the Faculty for signoff

II. Financial:

Interprets data to determine past financial performance and/or to project a financial probability
Develops complex financial reports for forecasting, trending and results analysis
Develops and oversees the maintenance of account budget monitoring systems
Monitors, identifies and communicates over expenditures to faculty and administrative staff; also resolves funding shortfalls
Keeps abreast of laws and regulations that apply in order to maintain up-to-date compliance with all sponsored and non-sponsored accounts
Identifies high-risk subrecipient and maintains compliance with the subrecipient monitoring policies and procedures
Oversees the procurement process for all faculty accounts
Reviews and approves procurement cards by the monthly deadline

III. Financial Analysis:

Performs analysis on budget performance, investigates variances, provides justification, and communicates to leadership, as requested
Assists in researching expense and volume variances
Seeks to resolve any expense posting errors and communicates proper expense allocation, as needed
Completes monthly reconciliation for the department accounts and analyzes budget patterns and project expenditures

IV. Financial Reporting:

Extracts financial data from various accounting and information systems and performs financial and cost accounting analysis of data
Assists in updating/preparing departmental dashboard and executive summary
Generates and distributes monthly reports and creates new reports to improve monitoring of revenues/expenses within the department, as assigned
Ensures expenditures for budgets are monitored and reports are prepared to maintain balanced account


This description is a general statement of required duties and responsibilities performed on a regular and continuous basis. It does not exclude other duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications (Mandatory):

Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, or other related field required
Three years progressively responsible related financial/accounting experience required
Additional education may substitute for required experience and additional related experience may substitute for required education, to the extent permitted by the JHU equivalency formula.
JHU Equivalency Formula: 30 undergraduate degree credits (semester hours) or 18 graduate degree credits may substitute for one year of experience. Additional related experience may substitute for required education on the same basis. For jobs where equivalency is permitted, up to two years of non-related college course work may be applied towards the total minimum education/experience required for the respective job.

Preferred Qualifications:

Work experience in a research, academic or university environment, and strong knowledge of SAP
Proficiency in COEUS and JAWS/SWIFT

Working Title: Financial Analyst

Role/Level/Range: ATP/03/PC

Starting Salary Range: $50,000 to $69,000 per year

For TTY users, call via Maryland Relay or dial 711.

The following additional provisions may apply depending on which campus you will work. Your recruiter will advise accordingly.

During the Influenza ("the flu") season, as a condition of employment, The Johns Hopkins Institutions require all employees who provide ongoing services to patients or work in patient care or clinical care areas to have an annual influenza vaccination or possess an approved medical or religious exception. Failure to meet this requirement may result in termination of employment.

The pre-employment physical for positions in clinical areas, laboratories, working with research subjects, or involving community contact requires documentation of immune status against Rubella (German measles), Rubeola (Measles), Mumps, Varicella (chickenpox), Hepatitis B and documentation of having received the Tdap (Tetanus, diphtheria, pertussis) vaccination. This may include documentation of having two (2) MMR vaccines; two (2) Varicella vaccines; or antibody status to these diseases from laboratory testing. Blood tests for immunities to these diseases are ordinarily included in the pre-employment physical exam except for those employees who provide results of blood tests or immunization documentation from their own health care providers. Any vaccinations required for these diseases will be given at no cost in our Occupational Health office.

title: Marketing Analyst
job_description:
PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF POSITION:

To assist in the development and execution of marketing campaigns including forecasting, performance tracking, reporting and analysis to support sales initiatives and customer acquisition efforts.

MAJOR AREAS OF ACCOUNTABILITY:

Provides critical support in the day-to-day execution of marketing programs and methods which includes all aspects of program, promotions, product set-up, database analysis, and post analysis.Generates campaign reporting for all Company programs detailing the profitability at a product, program and department level utilizing established Key Performance Indicator (KPI) metrics.Supports all aspects of the print, email and website home page planning and development process by executing house file selects and segmentation efforts which includes understanding profit-based mailing depth, issuing select instructions to list manager and coordinating data entry of source segment codes.Develops, coordinates and proofs promotional materials related to marketing campaigns. Monitors the creative asset process to ensure each message is developed, tested, all elements validated and deployed within all set deadlines.Maintains a detailed promotional calendar and schedules for marketing campaigns which drives sales and marketing messaging.Works with internal and external partners to communicate information necessary to execute marketing campaigns including working with a service bureau and other partners to provide direction and ensure that all deadlines are met.Generates pre-campaign analysis summaries, including profitability analysis, product category analysis, inventory planning reports, and new product performance summaries. Additionally, conducts post-campaign analysis including overall performance, segment breakdown, testing and promotional results.Develops and maintains an understanding of forecasting and budgeting methods and tools used for product and program level planning.Assists in the creation of back end contact strategy including membership/premier customer programs optimizing performance and advertising expenses.Establishes and sustains interactive relationships with external vendors and contacts to result in favorable networks that support the current and future goals of the organization.Ensures utilization of current best practices and compliance relating to permission-based marketing, privacy, spam regulation and deliverability in cooperation vendors.Monitors competitor and industry-leading retailers’ promotional offers to establish best practices.Assists supervisor in annual Marketing advertising budget process by providing analysis on program performance and trends.Keeps supervisor informed of important developments, potential problems, and related information necessary for effective management. Coordinates and communicates plans and activities with others, as appropriate to ensure a coordinated work effort and team approach.Performs related work as apparent or assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor’s degree in marketing, advertising, statistics, finance, economics, or a related field.At least 3 years of experience in marketing or position of similar responsibilities.Experience in database marketing analysis, direct response campaigns and statistical analysis and reporting preferred.Strong analytical skills including the ability to categorize promotions, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.Ability to work closely with others to coordinate projects involving multiple parties.Ability to work under pressure, handle multiple tasks, be attentive to detail, work independently and prioritize work in a deadline driven environment.Ability to work accurately with numbers.Must demonstrate a high degree of skill in grammar, punctuation, spelling and motivational language appropriate to the position.Strong Microsoft Office expertise with emphasis on Excel.Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing, with a wide variety of customers, employees and others.Demonstrates Northern Tool + Equipment’s 12 Core Competencies.

title: Marketing Analyst
job_description: As a leading mobile games developer, Jam City is looking to “level up” our talent. We’re on the hunt for innovators who consider themselves dynamic, collaborative, and thrive in a fast-paced environment. PERKS & BENEFITSUnlimited Vacation, Paid Sick Days & Holidays100% Employee Covered Medical, Dental, Vision Plan Base PlanLife Insurance, 401k, Flexible Spending Accounts, Commuter Benefits & MoreCatered Lunches & Well-stocked KitchensYoga & Wellness ActivitiesHappy HoursCompany EventsDog FriendlyAs a Marketing Analyst, you will play a key role in driving marketing strategies and decisions for Jam City’s Publishing and Product Marketing teams. Working across a variety of projects, you’ll conduct detailed analyses to understand the impact of brand marketing, social, app store optimization (ASO), store featuring, and more. You will be responsible for creating and monitoring dashboards, building complex data models and performing ad hoc analyses - with the goal of forecasting the impact and understanding the ROI of initiatives.The ideal candidate works well in a highly collaborative environment and is able to drive their own projects independently. Strong mobile game knowledge is a must, as well as experience with product, digital marketing and direct response campaigns. RESPONSIBILITIES: Partner closely with the Publishing, Data, & Product Marketing teams to identify impactful business problems, translate them into structured analysis, & effectively communicate the resultsAid in evaluating new marketing channels/partners, acquisition & retention initiatives to drive installs, & live game engagementConduct quantitative analysis, ad hoc reports, & statistical models to support decisions related to: brand marketing, social media, App Store Optimization, & featuring. Build & maintain BI tools in partnership with Central Analytics to make informed decisions quickly while empowering others cross functionally to have information readily accessibleWork closely with Data Science to produce forecasting models for install lifts, explore app store trends, analyze the impact of ASO efforts, and spot anomalies in store conversion Work with the Data Platform & central Analytics team to facilitate data ingestion & troubleshoot issuesStay up-to-date on current & upcoming innovations & capabilities in the mobile gaming spaceQUALIFICATION:Advanced degree (or equivalent) in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Math, Economics or in Computer Science with Modeling/Data Science coursework4+ Years Work Experience in gaming or mobile gaming including experience with building predictive modelsAdvanced SQL skills & familiarity with Spark (Databricks in particular) a plus.Familiarity with relational databases, data transformation, data mining, & ad hoc analysisAdvanced experience in Tableau or other similar visualization tool, spreadsheet analysis (e.g., Excel), presentation creation (e.g., PowerPoint)Familiarity with analytics and marketing tools, as well as knowledge in mobile measurement tracking tools (Adjust, Tune, etc.).Understanding of quantitative marketing concepts including CPI/CPM, LTV, ARPU, churn, conversion Skilled in analyzing data & drawing appropriate conclusions. Able to effectively translate statistical findings to marketing strategies that will positively impact the business. Ability to work with Database & Statistical applications; can automate routine procedures and create tools that increase productivity & efficiency.Team oriented with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects in a fast-paced, fluid environmentPassion for mobile games, able to represent multiple audience perspectivesMinimum of a Bachelor’s degreeABOUT JAM CITYJam City is an award-winning mobile entertainment studio providing unique and deeply engaging games that appeal to a broad, global audience. Led by CEO Chris DeWolfe, former MySpace co-founder and CEO, and COO Josh Yguado, former 20th Century Fox executive, Jam City is the creative powerhouse behind some of the highest-grossing and most enduring mobile games. Jam City’s global franchise Cookie Jam has generated more than half a billion dollars, and Panda Pop has more than 120 million downloads to date. The company also is the go-to studio for Hollywood, having developed immersive, narrative-rich mobile games around iconic entertainment brands. The company’s popular RPG game Harry Potter: Hogwarts Mystery was the #1 game in more than 40 countries at its launch in April 2018. Jam City has nine studios located in Los Angeles (HQ), Berlin, Buenos Aires, Bogotá, Burbank, Cedar Falls, San Diego, San Francisco, and Toronto.

title: Senior Marketing Analyst
job_description:
Mavis Discount Tire Senior Marketing Analyst

Put your career into high gear with Mavis Discount Tire! We're looking for a full-time Senior Marketing Analyst to join Team Mavis at our Operations Support Center in Millwood, New York. With over 700 retail locations, Mavis is the one of the largest independently-held tire sales and automotive repair chain in the United States.

About the Position of Senior Marketing Analyst

As a member of the Analytics Department, the Senior Marketing Analyst will support the Marketing Department by developing actionable insights through the rigorous analysis of varied data sources. The analyst will assist the Marketing team in the design, monitoring and evaluation marketing tests through its various sales channels. The analyst will also identify issues and promote opportunities for improvement with a focus on quantifiable impacts to profit.

Requirements & Qualifications

3-5 years of experience in sales/marketing data analytics

Web analytics experience including conversion funnel analysis, assessing heatmaps, and email metrics

Experience with Google Analytics and Data Studio

Demonstrated experience with SQL databases

Advanced experience with Excel and data visualization tools

Experience with A/B testing for optimizing online marketing

Experience with processing and communicating data & business insights

Experience applying various analytical techniques (advanced analytics, segmentation, forecasting etc.)

Strong ownership and demonstrated project management skills

Strong verbal and written skills

Duties & Responsibilities

Develop actionable insights through the rigorous assessment of multiple data sources

Perform diagnostic analysis of varied data to identify issues and promote opportunities for improvement

Design, monitor and evaluate marketing tests

Present story-lines of data insights to internal and partner teams that articulate opportunities to drive business performance

Work with internal team members from various departments to frame the appropriate questions in support of meeting business objectives

Provide consistent, accurate and timely reporting

Employee Benefits

At Mavis, we understand that our people drive our success. We provide our team members with competitive weekly pay, a good working environment and an excellent combination of additional benefits like health and dental insurance, a 401(k) retirement savings plan with employer match, paid vacations, paid personal and sick time, paid holidays, on-the-job training, and opportunities for career growth and advancement.

Mavis is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Employment decisions are made without regard to an applicant's or employee's actual or perceived membership in any category or status protected by applicable federal, state or local law. title: Business Development Analyst
job_description:
The OpportunityCO-OP Financial Services is bringing digital transformation to the credit union movement. We’re creating innovative technology solutions that help not-for-profit credit unions best serve their members and compete with the big banks. As a result, our world-class team is growing faster than ever! If you’re passionate about technology and want to be part of a purpose-driven organization, this is an exciting opportunity to provide real value and help shape the future of human-centered financial services.

We are seeking a talented Business Development Analyst to lead strategic projects and other data quality remediation planning activities. This position closely partners with business and operational teams. The Business Development Analyst detects patterns and possible solutions from smaller to medium volumes of data.What You Can Look Forward to

Leads strategic data driven projects.
Follows and advises on industry standards and advances on data driven technologies and tools.
Analyzes data to determine relationships between large datasets and project requirements.
Creates complex end-to-end data flow diagrams and logical data models.
Communicates complex SQL, T-SQL scripts for various reporting and ad-hoc analysis.
Documents business requirements, source to target data mapping; collaborates with technology teams; designs, develops, tests and works with Consultants.
Documents System of Record data models and maps to business process.
Documents data mapping specification designs, data feed specifications, data analysis and data comparison.
Develops and documents data remediation requirements and plans for specific client needs.
Responsible for reporting risks that are identified to the appropriate team and/or management. Additionally, responsible for managing, monitoring and reporting risks within the scope of your work area, to include, but not limited to Information Security risks.
Actively supports our CO-OP culture and embraces our core values of Work as Partners, Communicate Openly and Honestly, Demonstrate Excellence and Champion Change in all interactions.

What You’ll Need to Succeed

Completion of high school, or equivalent.
BS in Analytics, Data Science, Data Management, CIS plus 2+ years’ experience as a data analyst or equivalent training and/or experience.
2+ years’ experience with data technologies, process, data mapping tools with highly complex and integrated business models.
Ability to analyze data to determine relationships between large datasets.
An understanding of data warehousing methodologies.
Financial industry knowledge.
Agile methodologies.
An understanding of benefit of BI tools and how to communicate value to Consultants for client interactions.
Excellent knowledge of SQL, T-SQL, and SSRS.
MS Excel.
Tableau Desktop Pro.
MS Office including Visio 2013.

Why Join CO-OP?CO-OP is committed to fostering a workplace where every employee feels valued, respected, and connected. We are dedicated to understanding, attracting and engaging a diverse workforce where every employee can live up to their value; ensuring that our employee base reflects the consumers we serve. The result of this effort is an inclusive environment where diverse talent thrives. You will be part of an organization that focuses on a strong culture and embodies the credit union movement philosophy of People Helping People. CO-OP’s commitment to reflecting our own core values and purpose extends beyond how we serve our clients and the products that we deliver.

With more than 35 years of industry leadership, CO-OP Financial Services is the largest, most comprehensive credit union service organization in the nation. CO-OP serves as THE credit union technology engine, bringing payments solutions, engagement services and strategic counsel to help credit unions optimize member experiences to consistently provide seamless, personalized multi-channel offerings, while delivering secure, sophisticated fraud mitigation service.

CO-OP serves more than 3,000 client credit unions, with 60 million debit and credit cardholders, nearly 30,000 surcharge-free ATMs and more than 5,600 shared branches nationwide. Our vast technological ecosystem facilitates more than 6.5 billion transactions every year and equips credit unions of all sizes to deepen member engagement and prosper in the fast-paced world of fintech.The Perks

Fun, challenging and, collaborative work environment with passionate colleagues that care deeply about the intersection of technology and human-centered financial services.
Great Work/Life Benefits – Paid Time Off (PTO), Maternity, Parental, Family Care, Adoption Leave Programs, Community Volunteer Time Off, and 10 Paid Holidays.
Health benefits – medical, dental, & vision plus wellness programs and gym reimbursements.
401K with generous company match.
Tuition reimbursement.

title: Financial Advisor / Financial Services Representative
job_description:
CATHOLIC FINANCIAL LIFE ALWAYS WITH YOU

Catholic Financial Life (CFL) is looking for candidates with the drive to chart their own career course and the grace to guide our members through financial decisions during major life moments. We seek self-motivated, hardworking professionals who are disciplined and eager to work in a purposeful career committed to protecting our members futures.

At CFL, we work hard while making time for our families, friends and faith. We provide you with a rewarding financial services career while staying true to the faith-based and community-focused mission that built CFL. Come work with an organization named a Top Workplace by Milwaukee Journal Sentinel for six years in a row.

WHAT YOULL DO

As a CFL Advisor, you will:

• Educate and empower your clients to make sound financial decisions to protect their families and their futures

• Actively prospect for new members through community activities and your personal network

• Set your own earning potential through your hard work, persistence and dedication

• Leverage a strong support network while defining your own success

WHAT WE PROVIDE

As part of the CFL family, you will receive:

• Unlimited earning potential with negotiable and customizable compensation plans

• Flexible schedule - define your own workday

• Access to a full Group Benefits Package including health, life and disability insurance plus a 401K plan

• Motivating incentive rewards including an all-expenses-paid annual sales conference at a unique destination

• Industry-leading training, ongoing education and mentorship program

• Reliable, consistent and responsive sales support from the CFL home office

WHAT IT TAKES TO BE A CFL ADVISOR

• Self-motivated, self-disciplined, reliable and committed

• Trustworthy and passionate about educating others and being a part of their lives

• A high-achiever, driven by serving others

• Active and well-connected in your community

• Empathetic and perceptive to the needs of others

QUALIFICATIONS

• A two- or four-year degree, preferably in the Business, Finance, Insurance or a related field

• Strong written and interpersonal communication skills

• Previous sales or insurance experience preferred

• Access to personal transportation is required

We set the bar high for our financial advisors. We are looking to fill a limited number of positions and will only consider highly-ethical individuals with the desire to be top sales professionals. If you are someone that is driven to serve others and wants to earn a rewarding income along the way, then apply now and take advantage of our limited-time signing bonus.

Go to cfl.org/advisors to apply today.

About Catholic Financial Life

Through services including life insurance, retirement planning, education savings and more, Catholic Financial Life has been helping its members protect their financial lives for more than 150 years. With assets of $1.65 billion and nearly 140,000 members across the United States, Catholic Financial Lifes strength comes from being a different kind of financial community. As a member-owned organization, Catholic Financial Lifes longevity and success are a result of being a trusted financial partner. It has been recognized by the Milwaukee Journal Sentinel as a Top Workplace six years in a row.

For more information about Catholic Financial Life, visit www.catholicfinanciallife.org.

title: 2021 Corporate & Investment Bank Markets Full-Time Analyst Program - Research
job_description:
If you want to learn about how global financial markets move while working in a collaborative, supportive team structure, then sales, trading and research is right for you. Our teams research and identify opportunities for our clients, help them with complex financial transactions - and we do it all in a fast-paced, dynamic environment that's never dull. If you like working quickly, developing relationships or diving deep into analysis, we have a role for you.

What to expect

One of the world's most highly respected advisory franchises, J.P. Morgan's fundamental and quantitative research has earned top rankings in surveys by Institutional Investor. We provide thoughtful and differentiated fundamental analyses on sectors and companies and actionable ideas and thematic insights that empower our clients to make well-informed investment and strategic decisions.

From day one, you'll build your technical skills through extensive training. You'll participate in training in New York for four weeks of instruction in statistics, economics, credit analysis, valuation, financial modeling and more. Through hands-on experiences, you'll learn about the various assets classes - equities, credit, foreign exchange, commodities and emerging markets.

You'll make an impact by:

Modeling financial statements and industry dynamics Performing detailed valuation work Assessing relevant news events Analyzing complex data sets Writing research notes, sector pieces, industry and market overviews Advising internal and external clients, corporates and management teams

About you

Research is fast-paced, demanding and intellectually stimulating. We look for candidates who are eager to learn, inquisitive, and curious and possess strong critical thinking, quantitative, and communication skills. Key skills include:


Experience with three-statement modeling, forecasting, and valuation Exceptional writing skills Genuine interest in financial markets and economic data and trends Ability to multi-task and collaborate within a team environment Strong organizational skills and ability to meet deadlines in a dynamic environment Attend college/university in the U.S. Expected graduation date of December 2020 - Spring 2021 Minimum preferred cumulative GPA of 3.2 on a 4.0 scale Authorization to work permanently in the U.S.

Join us

At JPMorgan Chase, we're creating positive change for the diverse clients, customers and communities we serve. We do this by championing your innovative ideas through a supportive and inclusive culture that helps you every step of the way as you build your career. If you're passionate, curious and ready to make an impact, we're looking for you.

What's next?

Help us learn about you by submitting a complete and thoughtful application, which includes your resume. Your application and resume is a way for us to initially get to know you, so it's important to complete all relevant application questions so we have as much information about you as possible.

To get started, enter your email address. Your email address will be used to create and maintain your profile. If you are a current JPMC employee, use your JPMC email address to apply for jobs internally. Do not use an email address with ".edu" extension as doing so could result in delays receiving updates regarding your candidacy.

After you confirm your application, we will review it to determine whether you meet certain required qualifications.

If you are advanced to the next step of the process, you'll receive an email invitation to complete a series of 12 games through the pymetrics platform. pymetrics will allow you to showcase your potential beyond what you tell us in your resume and application form. It's an additional data point that helps us gain a better understanding of who you are as an individual. It should take no longer than 25-35 minutes to complete. If you have already completed the pymetrics games, you will have the opportunity to submit your gameplay results for this specific application without having to replay the games.

Following completion of pymetrics, you'll receive another email invitation to complete a video interview, powered by HireVue. This is your opportunity to further bring your resume to life and showcase your experience for our recruiting team and hiring managers.

Both pymetrics and HireVue are required, and your application will not be considered for further review until you have completed them. We strongly encourage that you apply and complete these required elements as soon as possible, since programs will close as positions are filled.

JPMorgan Chase is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that respects all people for their unique skills, backgrounds and professional experiences. We strive to hire qualified, diverse candidates, and we will provide reasonable accommodations for known disabilities.

Visit jpmorganchase.com/careers for upcoming events, career advice, our locations and more.

We recommend that you apply to one Markets program and no more than three.

©2020 JPMorgan Chase & Co. JPMorgan Chase is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer Disability/Veteran

title: Financial Analyst
job_description:
Tracking Code

 2619 

Job DescriptionThe Role

The Senior Associate role offers you the opportunity to expand your skills and experience in multiple areas, while providing exposure to multiple departments and key stakeholders across the company. As a Senior Associate, you’ll report into the Director of FP&A and will oversee a variety of finance functions, including coordinating reporting deliverables, developing cost center budgets and forecasts, and leading monthly variance analysis.

Our Finance Team supports and collaborates as a strategic partner to all internal departments. With locations around the world, we need a highly motivated Senior Associate to support our expanding portfolio. As part of the broader FP&A team, you will provide financial advice, counseling, and recommendations that will significantly influence the decision-making process and direction of business leaders. You’ll get substantial senior leadership exposure, focus on high priority business issues, and be plugged into key facets of the business.

The Responsibilities

Build strong relationships and become first point of contact with budget owners to provide meaningful financial reports.
Partner closely with Operations on items including financial reporting, key expense analyses, property allocations, forecasting/budgeting and others.
Update and interpret various portfolio metrics on a quarterly basis; define business rules and build out associated trends and analysis.
Liaise with different departments (Accounting, Asset Management, Operations, Finance) as required to improve efficiency and accuracy.
Prepare presentations combining qualitative and quantitative data; present findings and recommendations to senior audiences.
Perform various ad-hoc analyses, such as headcount metrics.

The Requirements

Minimum 2-5 years of experience in a financial analyst role or similar professional experience.
A strong understanding of and ability to create financial reports and analysis.
The ability to work in a fast-paced environment and maintain a high level of integrity in your work.
The ability to think strategically, to work with data and numbers, and to provide thoughtful, detailed analysis.
A team player mentality and strong learning acumen.
Experience in the real estate, property management or related industry is a plus, but not required
Bachelor's degree required

Digital Realty: Where the cloud lives and business thrives

We built the global standard for technical real estate, developing a unique capability to acquire, manage, and scale data center campuses. Now, Digital Realty is building a unique ecosystem of open solutions that power customer growth through exceptional service on a foundation of unrivaled data center expertise. The new Digital Realty combines unparalleled data center services, carrier-dense interconnection, real estate acumen, and financial strength to create unique power of choice and value when and where our customers need it.

Our Mission

To provide our customers with the trusted foundation for the digital world.

Our Vision

To build a network of connected campuses and internet gateways that become the heart of the internet and cloud, powering growth and prosperity for customers, employees and shareholders.

Our Values

Guide our decisions and actions every day—above all else, we value customers, excellence, talent, teamwork and success.

About Digital Realty

Digital Realty Trust, Inc. supports the data center and colocation strategies of more than 2,000 firms across its secure, network-rich portfolio of data centers located throughout North America, Europe, Asia and Australia. Digital Realty's clients include companies of all sizes, ranging from financial services, cloud and information technology services, to manufacturing, energy, gaming, life sciences and consumer products.

Digital Realty is a publicly traded company (NYSE: DLR) with investment grade ratings from all three major ratings agencies.

Digital Realty offers a highly competitive compensation package, excellent benefits, and an environment that recognizes and rewards your contributions.

Digital Realty is an equal opportunity employer, EOE/AA/M/F/Vets/Disabled

title: Financial Analyst
job_description:
Location: Washington, DC
Position Type: Full-Time

Citizenship Requirement: Must be a US Citizen, or have permanent residence status (Green Card)

Other Requirements:  Public Trust Clearance- must be eligible to obtain prior to starting
Job Description:

The main functions of a financial analyst are to gather and analyze financial information; will typically conduct quantitative analyses of information affecting investment programs of public or private institutions. A typical financial analyst is responsible for analyzing and communicating financial information for clients.

Job Responsibilities:

Performs research and studies subjects such as rates of return, depreciation, working capital, investments, and financial and expense comparisons by analysis of profit and loss statements and income statements.
May also perform analysis of budgets and schedules needed to meet contractual/project requirements for assigned portions of a program or programs.
Prepares reports of findings and recommendations to management.
Develops and implements fiscal operating policies and procedures.
Develops, maintains, and establishes operational specifications for financial information systems considering such things as information flow, volume, and document format for data processing equipment.
May provide analysis on business development and may monitor business performance by unit, division or brand.
Defines and develops key performance indicators; analyzing and interpreting financial and operational performance, and tracks key operational objectives and strategic initiatives to improve the efficiency and profitability of the business units.
Analyzes financial information to produce forecasts of business, industry, and economic conditions for use in making financial decisions.
Assembles spreadsheets and draw charts and graphs used to illustrate technical reports.
Reviews and analyzes monthly corporate and business unit financial statements, and quarterly and annual financial data in support of the SEC filings, as well as preparation of internal management analyses.
May also coordinate, negotiate and resolve financial compliance issues with various governmental agencies to ensure accurate interpretation of contract requirements.
Researches new policies and regulations and projects the effect that the same could have on the Company and its financials.
Assemble spreadsheets and draw charts and graphs used to illustrate technical reports.
Analyze financial information to produce forecast of business, industry and economic conditions for use in making investment decisions.
Interpret data affecting investment programs, such as price, yield, stability and future trends in investment risks.

Skills:

Verbal and written communication skills, attention to detail, and critical thinking.
Basic ability to work independently and manage one’s time.
Basic ability to analyze business trends and project future revenues and expenses.
Basic knowledge of economic and accounting principles, the financial markets, and reporting of financial data.
Basic knowledge of federal, state, and company policies, procedures and regulations as related to accounting.
Previous experience with computer applications, such as Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint, and any other related financial software.

Education/Experience:

Bachelor's degree in accounting or related financial discipline required. An advanced degree in a financial discipline is preferred.
2-4 years financial and/or accounting experience required.

***Will be remote work while COVID restrictions are going on. Once things go back to normal staff is expected to be on site in DC. They will be allowed occasional telework after CO

title: Financial Analyst
job_description:
ABOUT THE COMPANY 

DataRails is developing a Financial Analytics platform for the corporate finance function. The solution allows for the connection and centralization of all organizational financial data from various systems (ERP, GL, CRM) alongside Excel spreadsheets and operational data.

The solution allows for the creation of automated reports (P&L, cash-flow, budgets, etc.) as well as thorough analysis of consolidated data for the creation of business and financial insights.

DataRails is experiencing tremendous growth even during these difficult times because now more than ever, organizations need to conduct rigorous financial and business analyses that are quick and easy to operate. This is why we are looking for our next FP&A Analyst.
 ABOUT THE POSITION - Can work from home!


DataRails FP&A Analyst team is responsible for the customer's product implementation.



As a part of this team you are responsible for providing support throughout the client lifecycle.



The work involves frequent meetings (Zoom) with the company customers - Our customers are finance professionals that range from middle-management to high-level executives.



Working with both small and large US firms.



Analyzing current client situations, helping simplify models and existing data.



Implementing processes and client data within the DataRails environment.


ABOUT YOU

You must have 3 years of experience in FP&A positions (FP&A analyst / controller).



You must have deep understanding, knowledge, and experience in advanced excel functions.

Formulas, Vlookup, Pivot Table, Power Query and Complex Models.




You need to be a highly motivated person.



You need to have a great work ethic.



You must thrive in a start-up environment.

title: Financial Analyst
job_description:
Job DescriptionWe are seeking a Financial Analyst to join our award-winning team in delivering innovative technology solutions spanning mobile, enterprise web and gamification. The ideal candidate for this position should be organized and driven. The Analyst will work closely with our Controller to handle day-to-day finances.

Description

Analyze Revenue, prepare reports, monitor and track actual versus plan/forecast resultsDevelop reports on key performance metricsAnalyze and reconcile monthly payroll and benefitsCreate detailed spreadsheets highlighting trends and forecasts for revenues and expensesPrepare financial analysis reports.Assist in month/year end closingSupport other projects and functions of the accounting/finance department as needed

Qualifications

5 years of experience in corporate accounting and bookkeepingUnderstanding of General Ledger concepts/software (QuickBooks transitioning to new GL Package)Project billing & project accounting experience a plusHigh proficiency with MS ExcelBachelor’s degree in accounting or businessExperience with financial reporting

About 10Pearls

10Pearls is a growing, energetic, and highly-reputed product development company that specializes in mobile apps, enterprise software, gamification and great user experiences. Led by an experienced management team, and serving impressive clients, 10Pearls is seeking professionals with entrepreneurial spirits. We seek professionals who thrive on new challenges. Our employees have the unique opportunity of not only helping solve challenges for our clients, but also to help define 10Pearls’ growth and direction. Our unique business practices, culture and immense opportunity for growth help us attract professionals that have an entrepreneurial spirit. 10Pearls‘ diverse clientele includes start-ups and entrepreneurial ventures, high growth small and medium-sized business, as well as, large enterprises and corporations that are publicly traded.

We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to maintaining a diverse workplace.

title: Comm. Portfolio Analyst
job_description:
Education and Skills Requirements:

Bachelor's degree preferred.Minimum of 3 years of Commercial Real Estate Loan Underwriting or Portfolio Management experience preferred.Demonstrated ability to analyze Financial Statements and Tax Returns required.Prior Default Management experience relative to Commercial Real Estate Loans preferred.Prior Property Inspection experience preferred.Must be detail oriented, with excellent organizational skills and the ability to work well independently. Individual must possess above-average oral and written communication skills.

Duties and Responsibilities Include:

Determines an appropriate risk rating for each commercial loan by analyzing relevant financial information related to the Borrower(s)/ Guarantor(s) and/or the real estate collateral and by performing a comprehensive loan review. Such financial information may include. but is not limited to, Rent Rolls, DHCR filings, Leases, Income and Expense Statements, Personal Financial Statements, and Personal/ Corporate tax returns. 

Identifies trends within the portfolio by property type, geographic location and/or borrower.

Identifies potential problem loans by researching credit or other loan related risks discovered during the loan review and develops and recommends appropriate strategies to the department manager.

Follow up on problem loans to ensure that the issues are addressed and cured within a reasonable period of time. 

Assists in obtaining borrower and property financial information as delineated in the mortgage documents. 

Verifies compliance with undertakings entered into with the borrower at time of closing.

Job Description:Financial Analyst – Research & Clinical Trials

Position Highlights:

Under general supervision, reporting directly to Manager, Research Finance, performs a supporting role in the financial and operational activities of the Clinical Research Administration Division within the Office of Research Affairs. Exemplifies the Rush mission, vision and values and acts in accordance with Rush policies and procedures.

Position Responsibilities:

Support Clinical Investigators with sponsored clinical trials by generating invoices, submitting them to sponsors, documenting the account receivables, following-up with collection activities, and producing reports.
Establish and facilitate the monthly production of financial reports with analysis of expenses and revenue.
Review credit balances, post payments, distribute payments, and make adjustments, as needed.
Coordinate and reconcile revenue received to bank statements and accounting system reports.
Comply with institutional guidelines for posting accounts payable and accounts receivable within the appropriate timeframes.
Communicate with the study teams to ensure compliance with Standard Operating Procedures.
Assist in the development of training materials to ensure the logging of completed study visits is efficient and effective.
Provide oversight, mentoring, and guidance to junior team members.
Assist in the account close-out process
Set reasonable revenue targets and formulate strategy for maximizing revenue.
Interact professionally with all employees and external customers
Demonstrate desire to continuously improve skills through professional development efforts
Demonstrate ability to work independently and manage duties
Perform work in a neat, organized, timely and efficient manner

Position Qualifications Include:
Bachelor's degree in Finance, Business, Healthcare Administration or related field.
Three years of experience in financial analysis.
Excellent communication and customer service skills.
Detail oriented, organized and ability to work independently and prioritize workflow.
Proficient in MS Word and Excel.

Company Highlights:

Rush University's Clinical Nurse Leader program is ranked #1 in the nation by U.S. News & World Report.
Rush University's Nursing Anesthesia program is ranked in the top four in the nation by U.S. News & World Report.
Rush University is ranked 22nd on the Times Higher Education’s 2016 list of the world’s top 150 universities under 50 years of age.

Rush is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.Complete Application

title: Financial Analyst - Reconciliations
job_description:
Financial Analyst - Reconciliations

At Funding Circle there’s a mission that drives everything we do. Around the world, we want to help small businesses get the finance they need to thrive, creating thousands of jobs as they drive the economy forward.

We have teams in London, Denver, and San Francisco, we’re fusing finance and tech to build new opportunities for those who want to achieve more.

Are you made to do more? Join us!

We are looking for a Financial Analyst - Reconciliations to join the Investor Services Team focusing in the Financial Operations area at Funding Circle US. This position is based in Denver and is a contract for up to 6 months. The key purpose of this role is to work on a project within the reconciliation team as we build out the system to automate the daily reconciliation process. This role will involve the individual working closely with many teams across the business, including Finance, Loan Closing, Collection & Service, Payment Operations and Capital Markets Operations.

Key responsibilities include:

Carry out reconciliations of client money bank accounts and system ledgers, ensuring any issues are raised immediatelyLiaising with payment operations and various teams across the business to investigate transactions within client accounts and ledgersCollaborating with the Financial Operations colleagues and other teams to develop new reconciliation processes as well as identify improvements to current processesUpdating documentation outlining the reconciliation processesIdentify deficiency and risks in operations and escalate to line managerBe responsible for scoping and troubleshooting ad-hoc operational issues as they occurWork closely with product and technology to identify features and contribute to the development of the automatching system and reporting. Liaising with product and tech teams on any system changes and user acceptance testingAd-hoc project work

Our ideal teammate has:

Bachelors degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics or other quantitative discipline3+ years of experience with an emphasis in reconciliationsIntermediate to advanced Excel skillsExperience in Finance or Accounting and working with auditorsExperience with multiple financial systems and comfort navigating and learning systems quicklyIs able to self direct and who can work under tight deadlines with minimal supervisionExcellent numerical skills, enjoys working with data and solving problemsStrong attention to detail and determination with a high level of accuracyExceptional organizational skillsHonesty and discretion when handling confidential financial informationA team-player who is proactive, with excellent communication skills both oral and writtenIdentification with our mission, “to build a better financial world”Alignment with our core values: Think Smart, Make It Happen, Be Open, Stand Together, Live the Adventure

Bonus points:

VBA/Macro a plusFintech, lending or other financial operations and services experienceExperience with servicing and collections tools, industry standard practicesTechnical aptitude and/or experience developing systems and processes

At Funding Circle, we celebrate and support the differences that make you, you. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and affirmative action employer. We truly believe that diversity makes us better.

We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Let me know if you have any questions.

title: Senior Financial Analyst, FP&A
job_description:
Senior Financial Analyst, FP&A

Collective Health is currently looking for a Senior Financial Analyst, to join our Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) team. This highly visible position will engage in financial planning, strategic analysis and insights, reporting, process improvement and decision-making support.

As a member of the FP&A team reporting to our Director of FP&A your mission is to drive Collective Health's Financial Planning and Analysis support of our Customer Experience (CX) organization. In doing so, you will closely collaborate with senior leaders across CX. You will be leading the charge supporting Collective Health's largest function which is the face of our organization to Members and Clients. You must be intellectually curious and comfortable driving insights from large or incomplete datasets.

Responsibilities:


Establish oneself as a trusted partner to peers and senior leaders with an intimate understanding of stakeholder requirements to run the business as well as advanced understanding of the healthcare industry at large
Owning all financial models and insights in scaling and supporting Collective Health's CX function
Manage scenario planning process through ongoing headcount management and expense planning
Support monthly, quarterly, and annual budgeting and forecasting processes
Identifying new systems, tools, and processes to scale your support
Develop monthly close packages for CX Leadership (such Budgets vs Actuals, etc), focusing on key trends and variances to drive resource allocation
Develop financial and unit economic models leading to key insights driving efficiency in CX cost allocation and utilization. Readily partner and innovate with our business operations and strategy leaders

Qualifications:


2+ years working in a FP&A role
Experience with Adaptive Insights. We utilize the web-hosted version and OfficeConnect
Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing, including exceptional excel and PowerPoint skills to convey data and storylines. You will work directly with executives so delivering simple clean conclusions is integral to this role.
The desire to improve broken processes through automation and make your own job easier over time. We want to automate recurring reporting as much as possible so that you can work deeply in identifying efficiencies in our business
Expert MS Excel / Google Sheets skills - candidate should be comfortable with financial modeling and working with large amounts of data
Working knowledge of GAAP (Accruals, COGS, and Capitalization versus Expense). Your fellow FP&A team members carry CPAs so we get technical quickly

Collective Health is a technology company simplifying employer healthcare to make health insurance work for everyone. With more than 200,000 members and over 45 enterprise clients—including Pinterest, Red Bull, Restoration Hardware, Activision Blizzard, and more—our technical and customer experience teams are reinventing the healthcare experience for forward-thinking employers and their people across the U.S.

Collective Health is headquartered in San Francisco, CA, with additional offices in Chicago, IL, and Lehi, UT. Founded in 2013, Collective Health is backed by the SoftBank Vision Fund, DFJ Growth, PSP Investments, NEA, GV, G Squared, Founders Fund, Maverick Ventures, Mubadala Ventures, Sun Life, and other leading investors. For more information, visit us at https://www.collectivehealth.com

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability statusCollective Health

job_description:

This individual must be able to prioritize and organize workflow, as well as corroborate all facets of the operation and administration of client accounts. Ability to acquire a working knowledge of the portfolio of accounts by working closely with the Relationship Manager. Ability to interface with his/her Relationship Manager and Team Leader to ensure compliance both with governing documents and policies, and to ensure client satisfaction.

title: Financial Analyst

In January 2019 Stadium Goods became part of the Farfetch family of companies, which will help guide our evolution as we usher in the next chapter of scale and growth.

title: Financial Analyst
job_description:
Req ID: 91130

At NTT DATA Services, we know that with the right people on board, anything is possible. The quality, integrity, and commitment of our employees are key factors in our company’s growth, market presence and our ability to help our clients stay a step ahead of the competition. By hiring the best people and helping them grow both professionally and personally, we ensure a bright future for NTT DATA Services and for the people who work here.

NTT DATA Services currently seeks a Financial Analyst to join our team in Washington, District of Columbia (US-DC), United States (US).

Job Description

To assist in analyzing quarterly financial statements, create training materials for the OBDs, and perform tests over internal controls related to obligations, payments, reimbursement agreements, accruals, and payroll. Prepare reports detailing the results of testing and recommendations for improvements. Supporting the generation of PBC responses during the financial audit. The Consultants will provide operational support for a broad range of compliance activities designed to address the material weakness identified during the most recent financial audit. Provide training/instructional support to FS and the OBD financial community, as required. Provide program management oversight and reporting for key FS and Department stakeholders. The Consultants shall use financial management tools such as Excel and PowerBI to facilitate propriety and budgetary accounting analysis and obligation, payment and revenue based compliance analysis with data extracted from UFMS.

Required Qualifications:

1-2 years of Program Management At least 1 -2 years of federal financial management (preferable)5-7 years of relevant experienceFederal financial reporting (GTAS), reconciliations (FBWT, Payroll) and Financial Statement and note preparation Chief Financial Officer Act Audits OMB Circular A-123 audits Federal financial operations and system use Data gathering and analysis Analytical tools such as Excel, Power BI, etc. Business process reviews and streamlining

Education Requirements

BS/BA in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Business, Physical Science, or other technology

This position is only available to those interested in direct staff employment opportunities with NTT DATA, Inc. or its subsidiaries. Please note, 1099 or corp-2-corp contractors or the equivalent will NOT be considered. We offer a full comprehensive benefits package that starts from your first day of employment.

About NTT DATA Services

NTT DATA Services partners with clients to navigate and simplify the modern complexities of business and technology, delivering the insights, solutions and outcomes that matter most. We deliver tangible business results by combining deep industry expertise with applied innovations in digital, cloud and automation across a comprehensive portfolio of consulting, applications, infrastructure and business process services.

NTT DATA Services, headquartered in Plano, Texas, is a division of NTT DATA Corporation, a top 10 global business and IT services provider with 118,000+ professionals in more than 50 countries, and NTT Group, a partner to 88 percent of the Fortune 100. Visit nttdataservices.com to learn more.

NTT DATA, Inc. (the “Company”) is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit and business needs. title: Financial Analyst
job_description:
Here at the City of Atlanta, we are passionate about building and improving our community. Our Police Officers, Fire Fighters, and Building Inspectors keep our Citizens safe. Our Public Works Staff keep our City clean and help to maintain, build, and improve our Citys infrastructure. Our City planners help envision and shape future City growth. Our Parks & Recreation professionals enhance our quality of life. Our Engineers help to keep our drinking water clean, the largest airport in the world (by passenger volume) operating, and our buildings maintained. Along with the host of Finance, Procurement, and Human Resources professionals whose support is vital, we are the City of Atlanta! If youre seeking a meaningful role where you can make a real difference improving and growing our City, we welcome you to explore the job opportunities we have to offer.Posting Expires: 7/2/2020

Salary: Commensurate with experience

General Description and Classification Standards

Metro Atlanta is the third fastest-growing metropolitan area in the country. As the city continues to experience rapid growth, Mayor Keisha Lance Bottoms is committed to realizing her vision of One Atlanta an affordable, resilient, and equitable city for all.

The Atlanta Mayors Office believes that collaboration is necessary to help support pressing needs and innovative programming to best serve Atlantas 480,000 residents. Working with partners at the federal and state-level, as well as in our private and charitable sectors, helps maximize City resources and address our priorities, including affordable housing, support services, education, transportation, public safety, and community and workforce development.

To this end, the City seeks an experienced professional to perform post-award financial and accounting processes for grants. This position will be responsible for financial oversight of a portfolio of grants.

Supervision Received

The position will receive guidance and oversight from the Grants Services Manager for Finance and Data.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

• The Financial Analyst will serve as a credible and professional representative of the City of Atlanta by demonstrating professionalism, integrity, humility, knowledge, and excellence in carrying out the functions of this position.

• The Financial Analyst is responsible for providing departmental assistance to ensure compliance with grant program policies and procedures, accurate and timely recording of financial information in the Citys accounting system.

• The Financial Analyst will coordinate with the program analysts, service providers, and City departments as necessary for efficient and effective financial management of grants.

• The Financial Analyst will manage spending of various grant awards to ensure that all grant expenditures are reasonable, allocable, and allowable according to all federal, state, and local regulations.

• The Financial Analyst will review and approve assigned award/grant budgets and disbursements for accuracy, allowability, and reasonableness.

• The Financial Analyst will assist in the preparation and review of legislation.

• The Financial Analyst will participate in onsite monitoring and desk audits, while also performing monthly grant reconciliations and analyzing expenditures activities.

• The Financial Analyst will fund grant projects and update project accomplishments in the HUD Integrated Disbursement & Information System (IDIS).

• The Financial Analyst will have responsibilities that require training and development on the details of federal grant programs and policies, the systems and tools used by the City to conduct grants management, including IDIS, HMIS, SAGE, Oracle, eCivis, and the Microsoft 365 suite.

• These are typical responsibilities for this position and should not be construed as exclusive or all inclusive. May perform other duties as assigned.

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

• Preference will be given to candidates that can demonstrate a strong familiarity and experience with State and Federal regulations regarding grant programs, including HOPWA, CDBG, HOME, and ESG.

• Knowledge of federal grant guidelines (2 CFR Part 200).

• Knowledge of municipal government administration and functions.

• Excellent verbal communication, interpersonal, and relationship-building skills to effectively work with a broad spectrum of stakeholders.

• High energy and a passion for service and the strategic direction of the city, particularly as it relates to serving some of the Citys most vulnerable communities.

• High emotional intelligence.

• Highly industrious with a strong work ethic; sense of urgency/impatience for action.

• Integrity and humility that encourages and inspires constituents; strong sense of judgment.

• Ability to thrive under pressure, consistently meeting expectations and commitments on tight deadlines, all while managing a variety of tasks and relationships in an efficient and meticulous manner.

• Ability to plan and organize work; ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing; ability to maintain effective working relationships; ability to gather, analyze, and synthesize data.

Qualifications

Minimum Education and Experience Requirements:

• At least a Bachelors Degree

• At least three years of experience related to grants management, or non-profit project management

Preferred Education & Experience:

• Bachelors Degree in Accounting or Finance

• At least three years of experience in federal grants management related to HOPWA, HOME, ESG, and/or CDBG public services programs.

Licensures and Certifications

Drivers license valid at time of appointment and remain valid while in position.

Essential Capabilities and Work Environment

Required physical, lifting, and sensory capabilities are requirements to perform the job successfully. Typical environmental conditions associated with job.

Job Requirements:
