title: Senior Sales Financial Analyst
job_description:
Now Hiring Senior Financial Analyst – Sales FinanceKent, WA
Oberto Snacks, Inc., known for our high quality, delicious meat snacks are currently hiring ­ at our Kent, Washington corporate office. The Oberto Finance team is an integrated part of the business, not a detached corporate function. We partner strongly to deliver the best customer experience at the best cost while instilling a strong controllership environment. We constantly raise the bar through a focus on continuous improvement. Our ideal candidate will have a strong foundation in finance and quantitative analysis, an ability to think critically, problem solve, and an aptitude to learn new systems.The Senior Finance Analyst for Sales Finance will partner with the Sales team and the broader Finance team to continually improve top-line revenue in an efficient manner using timely analytics. The role will also support reporting and controllership processes as it relates to month-end close and variance reviews, customer trade and deductions, brokerage expenses, and other non-trade selling expenses. This position will work to develop and maintain sound business partnerships across a wide range of functional areas, including sales, marketing, accounting, finance and IT.PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIESINCLUDE:

Partner with sales team to maximize trade spend efficiency and support related controllership processes.Collaborate with other departments, gathering data to conduct and review financial analysis on promotional activity, line review strategies, merchandising, pricing decisions, co-marketing activities, etc.Own the trade spend forecast models as well as associated reporting by sales channel, key customer, and product category.Analyze financial results versus forecast, plan and prior year, and investigate variances, assessing risk and providing leadership with latest estimates; delivers meaningful business insights through the presentation of financial results to executive leadership team and sales team.Partner with Accounting to ensure integrity of accruals at an account, channel, and product level.Support Trade Promotion Management and Pricing Management systems, involving and training end users as needed, to drive data integrity in a timely manner.Calculating brokerage payments and streamline associated processes.Work with manager to step-change efficiency of existing processes, simultaneously simplifying current approaches and improving quality and fidelity of insights delivered.

QUALIFICATIONS:5+ years in corporate finance environment. Experience in Consumer Packaged Goods setting is desirable.Substantial experience in Finance and General Accounting specifically in the following areas: variance analysis, financial modeling, financial statement preparation and review and analysis.Experience working trade promotion software (example: TradePro) and/or ERP systems (example: QAD). Comfort with SQL, PowerQuery, and or PowerBI also a plus.

ABOUT OBERTO: We offer a creative environment filled with other talented people. We are committed to rewarding our teammates for their hard work, enthusiasm and professional excellence. Company perks include:

Competitive salaryAnnual performance incentive401K Plan with company match Employee Stock ProgramExcellent benefits including: medical, dental, vision, prescription coverage, short term and long-term disability and life insurance.

TO APPLY: Go to www.oberto.com/careers to see the full job description and apply for the position. Please include a resume with your application. Oberto Snacks Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer – M/F/Veteran/Disability/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity. Should you have a disability that requires assistance and/or reasonable accommodation with the job application process, please contact the Human Resources department at (253) 437-6100.

title: 2021 Corporate & Investment Bank Investment Banking Full-Time Analyst Program - Latin America Advisory
job_description:
Work alongside the top professionals in the business to come up with solutions that shape the global economy. Our bankers are focused on long-term relationships and developing strategies that help our government, institutional and corporate clients grow and innovate. We do this by providing sound advice, helping them access funds and making connections, all while helping clients manage the many risks in today's complex environment.

Our industry and product teams work together to develop and execute strategies that help our clients grow and achieve their objectives in today's global markets. Our global industry and product teams include: Consumer & Retail, Corporate Finance Advisory, Diversified Industries, Energy, Equity Capital Markets, Financial Institutions, Financial Sponsors, Healthcare, Investment Grade Finance, Latin America Advisory, Leveraged Finance, Media & Communications, Mergers & Acquisitions, Public Finance, Real Estate, Gaming & Lodging, Regional Investment Banking, and Technology.

Working here means joining a collaborative, supportive team. We want your diverse perspective to help us innovate the next wave of products and solutions for our clients. We'll give you what you need to succeed from training to mentoring from senior leaders to projects that engage all your skills.

What to expect

This full-time program offers hands-on experience with extensive training. You'll spend weeks with our leaders and top consultants learning about our products, services and business practices through interactive learning tools, case studies and modeling sessions. We provide extensive pre-training coursework to build your financial and economic expertise as well as dedicated Series 79 and 63 preparation.

You'll make an impact by:

Working on mergers and acquisitions processes and capital markets transactions Performing valuation analyses Building detailed financial models and executing transactions from pitch to close Analyzing market data, building detailed financial models and preparing client presentations Coming up with innovative and creative ways to solve complex, real-world business challenges Learning how we help clients and communities grow Sharpening your corporate finance technical skills Building your professional network with mentors, senior executives and others

Locations and groups you may join:

New York City: Latin America Advisory

About you

If you've got initiative and the vision to come up with strategies and plans, then this is the role for you.

Key skills include:

Excellent analytical, quantitative and communication skills Expertise in corporate finance or economics a plus Excellent leadership and collaborative skills Fluency in English Knowing your way around Excel, PowerPoint and Word Degree or Academic major in finance, economics, engineering or business Attend college/university in the U.S. (for U.S. groups) Expected graduation date of December 2020 - Spring 2021 Minimum preferred cumulative GPA of 3.2 on a 4.0 scale

Join us

At JPMorgan Chase, we're creating positive change for the diverse communities we serve. We do this by championing your innovative ideas through a supportive culture that helps you every step of the way as you build your career. If you're passionate, curious and ready to make an impact, we're looking for you.

What's next?

Help us learn about you by submitting a complete and thoughtful application, which includes your resume. Your application and resume is a way for us to initially get to know you, so it's important to complete all relevant application questions so we have as much information about you as possible.

To get started, enter your email address. Your email address will be used to create and maintain your profile. If you are a current JPMC employee, use your JPMC email address to apply for jobs internally. Do not use an email address with ".edu" extension as doing so could result in delays receiving updates regarding your candidacy.

After you confirm your application, we will review it to determine whether you meet certain required qualifications.

If you are advanced to the next step of the process, you'll receive an email invitation to complete a series of 12 games through the pymetrics platform. pymetrics will allow you to showcase your potential beyond what you tell us in your resume and application form. It's an additional data point that helps us gain a better understanding of who you are as an individual. It should take no longer than 25-35 minutes to complete. If you have already completed the pymetrics games, you will have the opportunity to submit your gameplay results for this specific application without having to replay the games.

Following completion of pymetrics, you'll receive another email invitation to complete a video interview, powered by HireVue. This is your opportunity to further bring your resume to life and showcase your experience for our recruiting team and hiring managers.

Both pymetrics and HireVue are required, and your application will not be considered for further review until you have completed them. We strongly encourage that you apply and complete these required elements as soon as possible, since programs will close as positions are filled.

JPMorgan Chase is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that respects all people for their unique skills, backgrounds and professional experiences. We strive to hire qualified, diverse candidates, and we will provide reasonable accommodations for known disabilities.

Visit jpmorganchase.com/careers for upcoming events, career advice, our locations and more.

title: Financial Analyst
job_description:
Job Req: 20-02537

Job TItle: Financial Analyst

Job Location: Valencia, CA- 91355

Job Title: FTE / Direct hire

This position is responsible for providing financial planning and analysis support. The Finance Operations Analyst will be a key team member of the FP&A team, partnering closely with accounting and operations. As a Finance Operations Analyst you will be asked to evaluate, analyze, and budget for financial & manufacturing operations. The Financial Operations Analyst will be expected to evaluate and analyze financial data to support corporate planning and commercial marketing decisions. Must have the skill set to monitor and analyze corporate trends, variances and results along with the business acumen to recommend actions, options, or strategies to management. Will provide support on measuring product cost builds (i.e., raw material purchases, labor usage and O/H). A successful candidate will have experience evaluating and analyzing revenue channels and operational cost structures in addition to a strong working knowledge of the cyclical financial budgeting & planning process.

Responsibilities:

Provide financial planning and analytic services, including: - Budgeting / Planning / Forecasting - Evaluating and analyzing actual results against plans and forecasts - Investment proposal analysis and post implementation assessment - Client support & reporting
Maintain internal FP&A operating parameters and reporting system.
Provide ongoing FP&A support to cross-functional areas.
Research and collect data on cost methods, processes and practices and provide reporting on effectiveness as well as recommending options or action items.
Translate operational findings into actionable insights that can impact production processes and facility management.
Ability to use modeling as a predictive tool to measure performance initiatives against established standards, cost parameters or other performance indicators.
Ability to interpret dashboard sales information to evaluate customer, channel and regional data trends to measure performance against established quotas.
Special projects and analysis as required.
Able to adjust to change productively and to perform other essential tasks assigned.

Qualifications:

Degree in Accounting or Finance required; CPA or CMA a plus.
Three to five years of work experience in accounting or finance, preferably a combination of both. Must possess a solid working knowledge of accounting. Experience in a manufacturing environment Cost Accounting processes is a plus.
Strong analytical and critical thinking with high attention to detail.
Strong technical experience in financial accounting & planning with experience analyzing financial reporting data and statements (i.e., IS, BS, CF).
Ability to evaluate operational spend activity, trends and dissect effectiveness of each.
Comprehensive understanding of financial ratio analysis and statistical data.
Evaluate operational cost drivers versus standard performance measures.
Strong proficiency with Microsoft applications (Excel. Word, PowerPoint).
Working experience with ERP applications; QAD Enterprise a plus.
Working experience with Salesforce or comparable CRM systems.
Works well under pressure and adapts to shifting priorities.
Ability to manage & lead multiple projects and tasks simultaneously.
Ability to work effectively and efficiently in deadline driven environment.
Excellent organizational, interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills


Company Description:About Ascent:

Ascent is a leading national technology consulting and professional services firm that focuses on tactical and strategic consulting. Ascents fundamental business is providing staffing services to Large Enterprise clients in our core market verticals: Financial Services, Healthcare, and Life Sciences. We focus the majority of our efforts in Staff Augmentation support of Large Enterprise Clients who utilize a Vendor Management System. Ascent works as both a reliable supplier in support of programs, as well as a Strategic Advisor in support of enterprise efforts to establish best in class preferred vendor programs. Ascent was ranked in the 2007 and 2008 Inc. 500 and recognized specifically for its innovative work in staff augmentation support of Large Enterprise preferred vendor accounts.

If you are ready to propel your career to new heights read on. We are looking for talented and dedicated colleagues to join our phenomenal team. At Ascent, we have created an environment where culture, commitment and opportunity converge to yield a truly unique place to work. We know that every employee has something important to say and that every employee is integral to our success. Where else can you walk over to a founder and talk about your ideas to help build our business and have that idea implemented in 48 hours? More importantly, we do everything we can to make sure our employees not only have great jobs, but great lives.

title: Senior Financial Analyst
job_description: THE CHALLENGEThere are exciting things going on behind the scenes at Eventbrite. Our product strategy continues to evolve and expand. Our team is evolving its capabilities to address the increased complexity of the business by strengthening our partnership with executive leadership to guide the business through this critical phase. Our goal is to partner with leadership and provide accurate, insightful, and action-oriented guidance for decision-making, especially as it relates to financial goals.THE TEAMYou will be joining a world-class finance team that tracks and seeks to understand the factors driving our growth, specifically as it relates to our operational expenses and financial goals. We ensure our objectives are feasible and work closely with senior leadership to ensure they have the resources, insights, and data they need to achieve Eventbrite’s mission. If you deal well with ambiguous situations, gravitate towards data driven results, and enjoy using numbers to tell stories, let’s talk. THE ROLEYou will collaborate cross-functionally with finance, executive leadership and product and marketing teams alike to turn financial data into actionable insights that help solve Eventbrite’s most complex challenges. You will connect the dots between shorter-term operational strategies and longer-term financial goals, build out best in class analytical capabilities, and drive incremental operational efficiencies through quantitative analysis.The ideal candidate is detail-oriented and relentlessly curious. You will have exceptional communication skills and won’t be afraid to speak up. You are an analytical all-star who can take complexity and bring order to data and decision-making.RESPONSIBILITIESSupport standard Finance cycles including close, forecasting, and associated management reportingWork closely with senior leadership to manage department budgets and allocation of resources to achieve company goalsDevelop complex financial modeling analyses that clearly exposes investment opportunities, risks and returns for a call to action to be made within the overall Eventbrite portfolio Support the purchase requisition process through approval and tracking of global company spend and some contract negotiationTHE SKILL SET4+ years of applicable experience in finance or strategy at a fast-growing company, or a background in a highly quantitative fieldAbility to cultivate effective relationships and work cross-functionally with strong planning, process management, communication, and organizational skillsStrong written and oral communication skills, including the ability to communicate complex ideasExperience working with large quantities of raw, disorganized dataStrong understanding of financial concepts and accounting principlesAdvanced Excel modeling and analytical skillsA degree in finance, accounting, engineering, mathematics, economics or related quantitative field or equivalent work experienceHaving as many of these specific qualifications is a plus, but transferable skills and experiences are equally valuableBONUS POINTSExperience with Adaptive Insights and Workday FinancialsExperience with Business Intelligence tools like Alteryx and TableauCalm in the face of uncertainty; comfortable working in a dynamic and hyper-growth environmentActive Eventbrite user with a passion for live eventsSense of humor and positive attitudeABOUT EVENTBRITEEventbrite is a the world’s largest self-service ticketing platform, powering millions of live experiences each year. We empower creators of events of all shapes and sizes – from music festivals, experiential yoga, political rallies to gaming competitions –– by providing them the tools and resources they need to seamlessly plan, promote, and produce live experiences around the world. Last year, the team served 795,000 creators hosting nearly 4 million experiences across 170 countries. Our mission? To bring the world together through live experiences. Meet some of the Britelings that make it happen.IS THIS ROLE NOT AN EXACT FIT?Sign up to keep in touch and we’ll let you know when we have new positions on our team.Eventbrite is a proud equal opportunity/affirmative action employer supporting workforce diversity. title: Financial Analyst
job_description:
REF#: 36840

CBS BUSINESS UNIT: CBS Corporate

JOB TYPE: Full-Time Staff

JOB SCHEDULE: Full-Time

JOB LOCATION: New York, NY

ABOUT US:

ViacomCBS is a leading global media and entertainment company that creates premium content and experiences for audiences worldwide. Driven by iconic consumer brands, its portfolio includes CBS, Showtime Networks, Paramount Pictures, Nickelodeon, MTV, Comedy Central, BET, CBS All Access, Pluto TV and Simon & Schuster, among others. The company delivers the largest share of the U.S. television audience and boasts one of the industrys most important and extensive libraries of TV and film titles. In addition to offering innovative streaming services and digital video products, ViacomCBS provides powerful capabilities in production, distribution and advertising solutions for partners on five continents.

\#LI-CW1

DESCRIPTION:

ViacomCBS is seeking a Financial Analyst to join the ViacomCBS Global Tech Finance team in New York, NY.

The Financial Analyst will support the Tech Finance Division of ViacomCBS and will focus primarily on creating and updating the financial analyses of the technology transformation initiatives. The Financial Analyst will be responsible for monthly reporting and financial modeling for the Integration Management Office (IMO).

As part of an aligned FP&A team, the Financial Analyst will report directly into the Manager of Tech Finance, will assist in ensuring the accuracy and integrity of forecasts and budgets, tracking performance, managing monthly operating expenses, and creating analyses to assist in driving informed decision making.

This position offers the right candidate an excellent opportunity within a successful and growing global media organization. It will provide a wide-ranging exposure to the evolving interactive content industry while working within the broader media umbrella of ViacomCBS Corporation.

Responsibilities:


 Maintain monthly Tech transformation forecast and actuals, including variance analysis. This process includes creating and documenting all financial analyses necessary to update the Integration Management Office (IMO) excel model.
Prepare monthly Integration Management Office (IMO) presentations based on input from department heads.
Update monthly financial models and detailed monthly variance analysis for senior leadership.
Maintain weekly technology spend reports including all technology related requests requiring CTO approval.
Work with cross-functional teams to complete monthly forecast reporting.
Prepares/reviews budgets, quarterly estimates, including analysis and reporting for P&L.
Assists in monthly P&L forecasts and variance analysis.
Prepares ad-hoc reports to support monthly transformation initiatives and special projects.
Develops in-depth knowledge of the business entities/department(s) supported.
Communicate across ViacomCBS Corporation Technology and Finance resources.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Basic Qualifications:


Minimum 4 years of experience working in Finance.
Strong quantitative and technical skills, especially Excel modeling.
Strong communication skills necessary for building relationships with management and the Finance organization.
Able to work under pressure with tight deliverables.
Enthusiastic team player.
Previous experience in the entertainment industry a plus.

EEO Statement:

ViacomCBS is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) including disability/vet.

At ViacomCBS, the spirit of inclusion feeds into everything that we do, on-screen and off. From the programming and movies we create to employee benefits/programs and social impact outreach initiatives, we believe that opportunity, access, resources and rewards should be available to and for the benefit of all. ViacomCBS is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, and Veteran status

If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access www.viacbs.com/careers as a result of your disability. You can request reasonable accommodations by calling 212.846.5500 or by sending an email to viacomaccommodations@viacom.com. Only messages left for this purpose will be returned.

Dresner Partners, a leading middle-market investment bank based in Chicago is currently seeking to hire an experienced investment banking analyst. title: Financial Analyst
job_description:
Job DescriptionStage 1 Financial LLC (headquartered in Orange County, CA) is pioneering the rise of a new industry, fully outsourcing the operational finance and accounting services for fast growing brands. We have experienced explosive growth in the past several years, currently working with over a hundred of the fastest growing brands in the country. Some current and past clients include: Herbivore Botanicals, Hatch Collection, Milk+Honey, Pinkberry, Skin Laundry, Skinny Dipped Almonds, Tosi, The Dry Bar, WHOOSH!, etc.

Our company culture values hard work, respect, and honesty. We promote from within and have long-tenured employees. We treat our employees as family and foster that through monthly team bonding events, employee of the month prizes, complimentary snacks, and so much more!

Role

This new team member will work alongside our Finance Director and Finance Team to support our clients in analyzing their businesses and building models to help them make fact based decisions. An ideal person for this role is a puzzler, cool under pressure, great at meeting deadlines, and willing to go the extra mile for our clients.

Job Responsibilities:

Support our base of clients in the development and execution of all financial planning models: including cash flow, strategic planning, annual budgets, and other ad hoc planning and analysis.Compile, consolidate and analyze operational results.Enhance reporting by working with our accounting and business intelligence teams to facilitate improvements made with systematic reporting.Participate in the preparation of annual and department budgets.Develop and maintain variance analysis to identify opportunities and potential risks/exposures.Work in congruence with business intelligence and accounting teams to build data warehouse by creating KPI’s, dashboards, and standardized reporting for product lines and divisions.Support the preparation of consolidated monthly financial reporting, analysis and insightful commentary for key stakeholders.Work with CFOs to develop board level analysis and presentations.Manage the review of capital appropriations for proper supporting documentation and accurate financial costing.Operational support including business partnering support in developing annual forecast & quarterly updates.

Requirements

BA/BS in accounting or finance

Strong verbal and written communication skills.

1-3 years financial analyzing/planning experience

Excellent time management skills

Advanced Excel Skills

Strong customer service skills/background.

Must exude courtesy, politeness, and patience

Must be team orientated.

Must be detail orientated.

Will be tested on:

PIVOT TABLE, VLOOKUP, SUMIFS, INDEX & MATCH, COUNTIFS, & etc.

Basic knowledge of QuickBooks under requirements.

Compensation:

Competitive base salary, bonus, 15 days PTO for your first 3 years & 20 days after 4 years, CPA eligible hours, advanced schooling flexibility, plus extremely competitive benefits including health, dental, vision, 401k plus more.

title: Financial Analyst
job_description:
Join a fast growing company that is transforming its industry! Financial Recovery Technologies has become a trusted partner to hedge funds, mutual funds, custodians, sovereign wealth funds, and other institutional investment firms, and our best-in-class people and technology have made FRT a market leader. We are seeking a motivated financial analyst to join our growing team. This role will collaborate with departments across the business to perform analyses, build financial planning tools, develop metrics and dashboards, and assist with creating and presenting outputs used to support management and the executive team in making timely and informed decisions related to our strategic objectives.

The role: As a Financial Analyst at FRT, you will:

Own financial planning and budgeting across the business


Develop department-level and company-level financial planning analytics, including budget/forecast, variance and sensitivity analyses, and identification of KPIs and other key metricsOwn variance analysis, forecasting/reforecasting, and financial performance reporting and communications to functional leaders, the executive team, and the FRT BoardDevelop models to be utilized for the annual budget/forecast as well as potential strategic initiatives
Identify issues, opportunities, and trends and prepare analyses to guide strategic business decisions


Review and analyze internal financial data to identify issues, opportunities and trends to provide the executive team and others with financial analysis input that will drive decision making including project profitability, productivity analysis, and return on investmentPrepare analyses incorporating external benchmarks, market and competitor data, and potential M&A or new business development opportunities to guide business decisions
Review corporate development opportunities, including M&A


Analyze potential deals as they arise to determine proper valuation or other deal terms
Perform ad hoc tasks as assigned by the Controller and CFO

Our ideal candidate has:

A Bachelor’s Degree in finance, accounting, economics or another analytical discipline; MBA or CFA preferredA minimum of four year of progressive finance experience; experience in financial services and/or fintech highly desirableExperience in building and managing finance processes, including forecasting, budgeting, and capital planningStrong MS Office skills; specifically advanced Excel skills with the ability to create financial models and analytics out of disparate and raw data sets and effectively present findings in an efficient and effective manner to members of managementAdvanced analytical and project management skillsExcellent written and verbal communicationsPassion and an ability to work in an entrepreneurial and fast-paced environmentDrive – you are self-motivated, hard-working, and able to work independentlyA collaborative style, prioritizing collaboration over credit, with an interest in building strong relationships with peers at all levels across corporate functions;Intellectual curiosity, with a demonstrated commitment to continuous growth; andOf course, a desire to join a growing company with a vibrant, entrepreneurial culture, dedicated to being the top provider in the class action recovery space.

WHAT FRT OFFERS:

Competitive salary and bonusHealth, dental, vision401k (with company match)Income protection plans (life, accidental death and dismemberment, short- and long-term disability) and access to a suite of voluntary benefitsClose to public transit (walking distance to Wellington T on Orange Line)Free drinks and snacksFree parking onsiteFree access to onsite gymFun, smart, diverse colleagues

title: Financial Analyst
job_description:
The Howard Hughes name is synonymous with an unrelenting passion for excellence. While his achievements in aviation and the silver screen are legendary, it was his investments in real estate that form the foundation of our company. With passion, determination and limitless imagination, he built one of the great American empires of the 20th century. At Howard Hughes, we live by our purpose to help people discover new ways of experiencing life - because its not just buildings and places that matter, its what you do with them that can change the way people live.

We aspire to be the most creatively driven real estate company in the world and we believe in fostering a culture that is built to last by cultivating curiosity and empowering every employee to find their story in this great organization.

POSITION SUMMARY:

The Financial Analyst will be responsible for gathering and evaluating information regarding the companys business and industry to produce analyses of historical data and to create projections of future trends within its operating segments. Further, the Financial Analyst will support the development and implementation of operating processes and procedures at the Companys corporate office and in the field.

ESSENTIAL JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

Analyze financial performance of potential and current properties and portfolios and prepare/present investment and strategic planning recommendations.Actively participate with corporate and field management on the preparation and implementation of the annual budgeting and re-forecasting process for each property.Run analysis and full pro forma for operating and development of commercial properties.Manage monthly operating reports including preparing the initial financial review, communicating with the field and improving the report automation as feasible.Analyze potential lease deals with a focus on net present value analysis, review and commentary on income statement and balance sheet, and lease terms and conditions. In addition, work with leasing on the front-end of a deal to provide analytical support.Provide workflow and policy support in Companys Lease Administration department.Assist with lease abstracting and review.Perform ad hoc reporting.Work closely with business leaders and company executives.Create financial forecasts based on market and industry data.Perform in-depth industry, market and competitor research.Take information from various sources, merge the data into a meaningful report and be able to explain how you reached your conclusions.Work effectively with experienced company professionals to gather data and to communicate conclusions.Make extensive use of spreadsheets, charts and presentations to illustrate analyses.Create financial forecasts utilizing MS Excel and PowerPoint.Review industry surveys and benchmarks, economic and demographic trends.Other responsibilities and projects as assigned.

KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS:

Minimum 2 years of financial analyst experience required.Commercial real estate industry experience strongly preferred. A strong interest in pro-active management and operations of commercial real estate properties a must.Strong financial analysis and statistical background. Inquisitive and intellectually curious.Comfortable working with large databases.Self-starter.Build positive working relationships with employees at all levels within the organization.Exercise sound judgment when making decisions.Work overtime as required.Able to meet deadlines.Effectively work with minimal supervision.Strong attention to detail.Exceptional communication skills both verbal and written.Good problem solver/critical thinker.Can-do attitude, pro-active and resourceful.Highly proficient in Microsoft office applications specifically Excel and Power Point.Exposure to Argus, Kardin Systems, JDE and Salesforce a plus.

EDUCATION, CERTIFICATIONS AND LICENSES:

Bachelors degree required.

title: Investment Associate
job_description:
The Howard Hughes Medical Institute—HHMI—is an independent philanthropy that drives science forward by supporting biomedical scientists, educators, students, and schools with the potential to make transformative impact. HHMI believes in the power of people, not projects, to make discoveries that benefit all. HHMI-supported scientists have made major advances in understanding basic biology, disease, and other key scientific areas. So far, 29 current or former HHMI scientists have won the Nobel prize.

We are seeking an Investment Associate to join HHMI’s investment office, which manages an endowment with net assets of more than $20 billion.

At our headquarters, we provide space for collaboration and interaction beyond your office – sunlit rooms, artwork, beautiful grounds, gyms with classes, snacks, and, of course, smart people and innovative work all around.

As an Investment Associate, you will support the management of the Institute’s endowment. Responsibilities include supporting investment decision making in two broad areas: (1) markets and/or economic research and (2) investment strategy and manager evaluation. This is a generalist role; you will be expected to participate in the evaluation of investment opportunities across all major asset classes including global public markets, hedge funds, real assets and private equity.

The Associate will support investment decision making in:


Assessing attractiveness of global markets and investment strategies
Manager identification, evaluation and diligence across multiple asset classes including public equities, hedge funds, real assets, private equity
Monitoring and re-underwriting existing investments
Review of direct co-investment opportunities and special projects
Asset allocation and risk management
Preparation of internal and investment committee reports for discussion
Promoting the development of new ideas, areas of research, and methods of investing

Required Skills

Superior financial modeling and analytic skills with a firm understanding of investment theory and financial markets
Excellent research and critical thinking skills capable of synthesizing large amounts of data and information in a clear and concise manner
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Ability to take initiative, manage multiple tasks simultaneously and meet deadlines
Willingness to make independent assessments and recommendations
Passion for investing and intellectually curious
Proven history of success and achievement
Desire and ability to work in a team-oriented, collaborative environment

Required Experience

Bachelors degree required; pre- and post-MBA candidates considered
Two to five years of related work experience

The position is for a three-year appointment. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis.

HHMI is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

As a note for job seekers: We are thrilled by your interest in our organization. Please be aware that HHMI’s recruitment team will never contact you from an email that does not end in @hhmi.org, @janelia.org, or @janelia.hhmi.org and we will never ask you to participate in a Google Hangouts activity. Your best option for consideration in our career opportunities is to apply directly via our HHMI Careers site, which is accessible via www.hhmi.org/Careers. There, you will learn more about HHMI and can find information about our available roles.Job Location

Chevy Chase, US-MD

title: Financial Analyst
job_description:
Req. ID: 204406

Micron Technology’s vision is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life and our commitment to people, innovation, tenacity, collaboration, and customer focus allows us to fulfill our mission to be a global leader in memory and storage solutions. This means conducting business with integrity, accountability, and professionalism while supporting our global community.

Our Consumer and Components Group (CCG) business unit leads our branded consumer business (Crucial SSDs/DRAM modules, Ballistix Gaming, etc.) and our component/SpecTek businesses. As a Financial Analyst you will be responsible for communicating monthly results to the CCG and Consumer Products Group (CPG) General Manager, driving the CCG budgeting process, and supporting dashboard reporting processes. You will influence business decisions through financial analysis and communication! This is a highly collaborative role working closely with the CCG business teams.

Your role:

Monthly reporting and analysis of business results including commentary and insights to senior CCG managementSupport the CCG forecast process through partnership with marketing, operations, and the engineering teams. Load forecast inputs into the system, build presentations, and communicate the budget and key messages to partnersDrive process and reporting improvements to meet the requirements of internal customersSupport the regular dashboard reporting processesOther responsibilities and objectives to be added as business requirements emerge

We are looking for:

Business insight and market awareness of technology marketsAbility to collaborate with business partners and influence key decisionsOutstanding quantitative and analytical skills; proficiency in using standard office tools such as Microsoft Excel and the ability to learn Micron’s systemsSelf-motivated and reliable with passion for with meeting resultsExcellent oral and written communication – ability to deliver clear and concise message

Educational Requirement:

Bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting or related field of study.

About Us

As the leader in innovative memory solutions, Micron is helping the world make sense of data by delivering technology that is transforming how the world uses information. Through our global brands - Micron, Crucial and Ballistix - we offer the industry's broadest portfolio. We are the only company manufacturing today's major memory and storage technologies: DRAM, NAND, NOR and 3D XPoint™ memory. Our solutions are purpose built to leverage the value of data to unlock financial insights, accelerate scientific break throughs and enhance communication around the world.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

For US Sites Only: To request assistance with the application process and/or for reasonable accommodations, please contact Micron’s Human Resources Department at 1-800-336-8918 or 208-368-4748 and/or by completing our General Contact Form

title: Financial Analyst
job_description:

At WP Engine, we strive to do the best work of our careers and feel empowered to do what is right for our customers. Every year, more than $2 billion of work is done through Upwork by skilled professionals who want the freedom of working anytime, anywhere. Top companies connecting with extraordinary talent around the globe? Upwork is how.

Upwork is looking for a Financial Analyst to help make sound financial decisions. Your work will include but is not limited to cross functional business partnering, modeling business scenarios, tracking performance measurements and guiding the company for strategic decision making.

You are a highly motivated teammate, have excellent attention to detail, can work cross functionally in a team environment, as well as independently. Analyze financial data to build models for decision support and guidance

Perform variance analysis, identify trends and make recommendations to the business

Excellent communication and internal personal skills
Modeling, reporting and presentation skills (Adaptive Insights, Excel, G-suite experience a plus)

How to really knock our socks off:

Previous AWS forecasting
Experience with internally developed software (IDSW) capitalization forecasting and tracking
Experienced in change management

title: Financial Analyst
job_description: Summary of PositionZelis is intensely focused on combining our entrepreneurial spirit with our deep healthcare IT expertise to keep our Company and Clients at the forefront of innovation. We have an exceptional opportunity for a FP&A Data Analytics Analyst at our St. Louis location.The Data Analytics Analyst will support the FP&A Manager and Finance team in establishing methods to gather data, perform critical analysis and share business insights that drives value across the enterprise. The successful candidate will be proactive and curious, possess great communication skills, and most importantly, get a charge out of turning raw data into visually appealing, actionable knowledge/business intelligence.Zelis's Finance team is focused on being the analytical backbone of the company by providing financial modeling, fact-based analyses and interpretation of key business drivers and strategic insights from a financial point of view. Success in this role means you have empowered your colleagues to deliver a more accurate forecast, perform more advanced scenario analyses, and better support decision making throughout the enterprise. The right candidate will be energized by a fast-paced, high-growth, private equity-backed environment, combined with a great company culture.Duties & Responsibilities* Assist the FP&A Manager in developing data-driven presentations with conclusions, reconciliations, verification and recommendations in concise formats for management and the Board on a monthly, quarterly and ad-hoc basis.* Improve current methods used in the collection and analysis of data by learning and implementing advanced technical tools to automate accuracy and timeliness of monthly financial processes.* Work with large and complex datasets to establish dashboards that drive profitability and efficiency by analyzing and reporting on key performance indicators (KPIs), business drivers and unit economics through segmentation analysis.* Collaborate with business leaders and cross-functional groups to enhance the depth and value of KPI reporting over time.* Boosting the organization's financial performance through the analysis of financial results, forecasts, variances and trends.* Design and develop various financial models to support valuation, planning, and forecasting, along with assisting in the process of capital budgeting and expenditure planning.* Coordinate with various project managers in order to improve proprietary system performance and features.* Grow with the evolving needs of the Company's FP&A function and the broader organization, along with facilitating a culture of continuous improvement.* Challenge the status quo and current interpretations of data based on the results of advanced analytically-based conclusions.Professional and Interpersonal Skills* Fingers-on-keyboard data analytics experience, including direct responsibility for manipulating and analyzing data in amazing ways.* Familiarity with standard financial reporting layouts and analysis, including budgeting/forecasting, audience-appropriate level of detail and KPI/operational metrics visualizations.* Familiarity with some or all of the following (or similar) software tools: Excel PowerPivot, Adaptive Insights, SQL, Access, Alteryx and PowerBI. Past self-study in these or other similar systems is a strong plus.* Professional-level attention to detail and eagerness to dig into data to develop, verify and empirically prove out key insights, along with an ability to stay open-minded to reconsider initial conclusions from different angles on the fly.* Miraculous ability to translate complex, technical and difficult to solve analytical problems into understandable and easily consumable reports.* Creative problem solver and analytical thinker.* Self-starter/ability to work independently in a fast-paced, rapidly changing and sometimes ambiguous environment.* Early demonstrated success driving positive change in an evolving/growing role.* Must possess excellent project management skills and an ability to actively collaborate in cross-functional teams.* General working knowledge of GAAP/accounting a plus.Education and Experience* Two years-plus in related-role experience FP&A analytical responsibility at an operating company or corporate investment banking a definite plus.* Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting and/or Computer/Decision Science preferred - other related advanced degree (or similar demonstrable self-study) a plus.We are ZelisA Company's culture is vital to its success and the Zelis community is no different. We pride ourselves on being a growth company that maintains an entrepreneurial feel. title: Accounting Analyst / Sr. Analyst High Risk Assets Capital Accounts
job_description:
At Farm Credit Mid-America, we believe people are our strongest asset. We are consistently looking to hire individuals from a wide range of experience and capabilities who have a desire to serve. Currently, we have over 1,100 employees across Indiana, Ohio, Kentucky and Tennessee.

BASIC FUNCTION:

Provides accounting services to Farm Credit Mid-America offices by analyzing requests, reconciling loan and general ledger related accounts, maintaining efficient and accurate financials in connection with high risk assets, participations, syndications, investments, providing phone support to retail offices and/or customers, creating accounting system entries using the appropriate procedures and accounting principles, provide cash management support to Agribank and retail offices, and ensuring the work is accurate. This position is expected to resolve a wide variety of accounting, accounting system, and treasury management issues and refers to the director for resolution. This position is also responsible for training other staff (central and retail office) and monitoring their work quality, track basic work quality progress of other accountants for the director and assists in the completion and dissemination of accounting requests between accountants.

SUPERVISES:

The employee does not directly supervise any employee, but they are responsible for coaching others as part of the team environment. The employee will coordinate and communicate with members of the Financial Operations team, senior management, retail leaders, and Louisville office support leaders. They will also represent the High Risk Accounting & Capital Accounts (HRACA) group on cross-functional teams, and attend meetings on behalf of the director and the HRACA team.

The Senior High Risk Accounting & Capital Accounts Analyst is also responsible for training other staff (Louisville and retail office), monitoring work quality and tracking basic work quality progress of other accountants in partnership with the Director. They will also be responsible for departmental project work, and representing the HRACA team on cross-functional teams and projects. This position assists in the completion and workload distribution of the HRACA requests between team members. Attends advanced training courses to prepare for advancement and build competency in serving as a backup for the Director.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:

 Provide quality service and support to Farm Credit Mid-America staff, customers, AgriBank staff, and outside vendors by answering questions, researching problems, and providing solutions from multiple sources including email, multi-line phone queue, and internal software systems. Maintain expertise in accounting systems, association practices and procedures and cash management protocols to provide technical support to Farm Credit Mid-America staff, Agribank staff and Farm Credit Mid-America customers.
Process/approve remittances and other transactions to identify fees payable to the Association, State specific programs, and other third-party partners while also validating the external transactions generated by other HRACA teammates.
Acquire and maintain knowledge of general ledger, sold records, interest rates, capital markets, syndications, investments, and agribusiness in order to identify and resolve problems utilizing accounting systems and other resources.
Perform HRACA servicing actions, loan modifications, and reconciliation of high-risk asset and capital accounts based on analysis of accounting requests that require the application of ASC 310; 360; FCA 620, and other Accounting or regulatory standards. These Accounting requests will require analyzing legal documents, document validation for data integrity, and complex problem solving.
HRACA Analyst will prepare and submit accounting entries involving complex calculations and transactions (including gains, losses, charge offs, reserves, income recognition, and loan/investment modifications).
Monitor credit bureau compliance surrounding loan servicing while also adhering to RESPA & CFPB compliance standards. Update and maintain credit bureau reporting for discharges, releases, past due counters and other legal actions while assuring high data integrity standards.
Enforce association fraud prevention and compliance by processing and obtaining approval for outgoing wires, ACH disbursement setups, fraud analyst review, and internal/external fraud review.
Analyze association-rejected transactions in relation to fraud monitoring protocols and Accounting guidelines. Monitor, document, and report changes that could impact financials
Monitor, process entries, and maintenance association Other Real Estate Owned properties to correctly treat assets in financial reporting and GAAP guidelines under ASC 310;360.
Analyze reporting for loans requiring servicing actions, charge offs, reserves, and disqualification. Review association loan portfolio for potentially distressed accounts, delinquencies, and loans that require special handling under FCA 621.
Acquire and maintain expertise in accounting systems, association practices and procedures, GAAP/ASC guidelines, and cash management protocols to provide technical support to Farm Credit Mid-America staff and internal/external bank staff, while maintaining the integrity and control processes surrounding treasury and cash management functions
Create reports and data monitoring tools via the Data Warehouse or other data retrieval options to maintain the integrity of the Accounting system and related applications. Maintaining data integrity in third party reporting in regards to delinquencies, IRS reporting, and other internal/external reporting.
HRACA Analyst will monitor reports and reconcilements for accurate financial reporting complete loan loss analysis, cash basis testing for the association, and any other reports needed to prevent data misstatements. Maintain regulatory compliance for consumer (CFPB & RESPA) loans.
Audit completed HRACA servicing actions and HRACA reconciliations by other team members for accuracy, timeliness and production analysis
Represent HRACA in meetings with external/internal auditors, Internal Control reviewers, and other accounting projects and cross-functional teams.
Train and mentor new team members.
Performs other duties as assigned.

Additional responsibilities of the Senior Accounting Analyst includes:

Participates actively in and/or facilitates team meetings to support the Director and identify issues for discussion and training.
Represents HRACA team and the Director on cross-functional team projects. Projects could represent Association or District initiatives.
Support and facilitate the training and mentoring of new team members.
Monitoring and Reviewing HRACA team process and manuals for accuracy and facilitates the updates for changes in process and/or accounting practices.
Shows significant experience and expertise in the major responsibilities above

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:

Associate’s Degree or equivalent classroom hours plus four years of experience in relevant loan servicing, accounting, banking or financially related customer support while using a variety of business software, demonstrating proficiency in Excel; one to two years of Association experience desired or Bachelor’s Degree plus two to three years of experience in loan servicing, accounting, banking or financially related customer support using a variety of business software, demonstrating proficiency in Excel; one to two years of Association experience desired.





Farm Credit Mid-America is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, veteran status, disability or any other category protected by law.

title: Financial Advisor
job_description:
Career with a Purpose: The Financial Advisor Opportunity

Youll have the unique opportunity to create your own destiny and potentially have a lifelong impact on the lives of your clients, families, and your community. Northwestern Mutual offers a personalized approach to uncovering financial solutions tailored to each client's individual needs.

Your goal is to discover each client's needs and goals and help map a path to meet them. You will:

Decide how to build your practice by choosing your clients and the markets you want to pursueBuild your business to the level of success to which you aspireHave an opportunity to achieve financial independence with a rewarding career that can offer flexibility for family, friends, and leisure-time activitiesHave access to powerful sales tools and a large network of supportBe responsible for efficiently and effectively driving sales and developing relationships with clients by understanding their goals and objectives

Northwestern Mutual will provide consulting resources to help you discover and build your markets to develop a successful practice as a Financial Advisor including:

Developing your business and marketing plansExtensive training and coaching from certified trainersAccess to knowledgeable groups of Financial Advisors and specialists to assist you in sales objectives

At Northwestern Mutual, were committed to mutual success. Youll find people with varied experiences and perspectives in an environment that emphasizes teamwork and collaboration. For us, diversity means valuing and respecting differences so that we bring out the best in each other. You can be yourself while building your career here.

Desired Financial Advisor Qualifications:

Bachelors DegreeStrong interpersonal skillsSelf-starter and highly motivatedHistory of personal successPrevious sales experience is a plusPrior experience in finance is NOT required

About Northwestern Mutual: Northwestern Mutual One of the "Worlds Most Admired" life insurance companies according to the 2015 edition of FORTUNE® magazine, Northwestern Mutual has been a leader in providing financial security to clients for over 150 years. Founded in 1857, our company is well-positioned to help manage financial risk and achieve financial security in today's complex world. Through a needs-based process, Northwestern Mutual helps clients determine their financial security needs and then address those needs using a wide range of products. For clients seeking personal financial security, or security for their business or estate, Northwestern Mutual and its subsidiaries offer an array of solutions, including permanent and term life insurance, disability insurance, long-term care insurance, annuities, and investments.

Our offices are located in Fairfield, Stamford, and Westport.

Internship opportunities available for those enrolled in school

Experience:

relevant: 1 year (Preferred)

Bachelor's (Preferred)

Commission

Multiple locationsOne location

Benefits:

Health insuranceDental insuranceVision insuranceRetirement planFlexible scheduleProfessional development assistance

This Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:

High stress tolerance -- thrives in a high-pressure environmentInnovative -- prefers working in unconventional ways or on tasks that require creativityAchievement-oriented -- enjoys taking on challenges, even if they might failPeople-oriented -- enjoys interacting with people and working on group projectsAdaptable/flexible -- enjoys doing work that requires frequent shifts in direction

title: Financial Analyst, FP&A
job_description: The Analyst in Financial Planning & Analysis (“FP&A”) is responsible for preparing quantitative qualitative analysis to support the strategic objectives of CIM’s funds and management companies and providing actionable recommendations to relevant stakeholders.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Coordinate and collaborate with other departments such as Investments, Property Management, Finance & Accounting and Information Technology to understand business objectives, validate the quality and completeness of data analyzed, and communicate the results Build and maintain models that serve as the primary source of asset-level, investment-level and fund-level financial projections. Ensure that models are built consistently across similar asset and/or investment strategies and are efficiently integrated with other data sources and reporting tools Participate in the budgeting and forecasting process by assisting with the formulation and collection of key assumptions, preparing asset-level budgets and analyzing resultsAssist with process improvement and standardization of budgets and long-term projections Ensure management fee and distribution allocations are calculated and incorporated into projections and performance metrics accurately using fund agreements, co-investments, joint ventures and fund/investment level-debtCompile key operating metrics on a historical and projected basis using real estate operating metrics from multiple property types Ensure fund level financial performance metrics are prepared on a historical and projected basis using GIPS, REIS and US GAAP Analyze, organize and improve data flowing through financial models, reports and systems using logical database modeling concepts and relational database management Analyze and explain variances between actual results and budget/underwritingIdentify and explain differences between various reporting basis, such as cash, accrual, historical cost, tax, and fair value, and adjust model outputs, presentation materials or investor requests as needed EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS: (including certification, licenses, etc.) Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting or related field 1 to 3 years previous financial analysis experience Knowledge of GIPS, REIS and US GAAP (optional)Real estate/private equity experience (optional) Investment banking experience (optional) Management consulting experience (optional) Big 4 or other public accounting experience (optional) Public REIT experience (optional) CPA, CFA, MBA (optional) Proficient with Microsoft Office: Excel, Word, Access & PowerPoint Knowledge of logical data modeling concepts Experience with Yardi, MRI, J.D. Edwards or comparable software (preferred) Experience with ARGUS (preferred) SQL, VB, VBA, .NET (optional) CIM does not accept unsolicited resumes from Agencies. title: Financial Analyst
job_description:
Since 2005, BOLD has established itself as a job seeker's ally. Unlike our competitors that specialize in posting jobs for employers, BOLD's focus steadfastly remains on the job seeker. Our top-rated tools offer job seekers of every walk of life the help they need to get the jobs they want.

A profitable, mature startup, BOLD walks with the job seeker through every phase of the job search process. Our award-winning resume and cover letter builders have helped millions of job seekers in more than 180 countries create the application materials they need to succeed.

BOLD's brands have a presence across the globe and BOLD is continuing to build its international offerings and serve millions of job seekers.

Position Summary:

We are seeking candidates who are business-minded, data-driven and have the desire to impact company's decision and future. As a Financial Analyst, you will be working side by side with Product Managers, Marketing team leads, and Business Intelligence team to forecast and analyze business performance and help grow new business. The successful candidate will have about 8 years of progressive experience in finance, and be comfortable with both quantitative and qualitative financial analysis.

Position Responsibilities:

Support annual budgeting and monthly forecasting process by maintaining and improving forecasting models and working closely with product managers and marketing teams to set goals and priorities
Support the re-forecasting process by leveraging large amounts of operational and transactional data from various sources
Help improve forecasting accuracy across all brands by improving consistency in assumptions and methodologies
Build financial models to analyze business opportunities for new product lines or new markets, and conduct variance and scenario analysis
Work closely with product managers to have a deep understanding of the product offering and competitive landscape
Build financial performance presentations for Executives and Product Managers
Respond to ad-hoc requests

Required Qualifications:

2-4 years experience as a business or financial analyst
BA in finance, accounting, economics or related field; advanced degree preferred
Ability to collect, analyze and summarize large amounts of data to drive actionable insights
Strong Microsoft Excel & PowerPoint skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Attention to detail and excellent follow through. Demonstrates self-management and initiative
Analytical, Logical thinking and naturally inquisitive
Experience in presenting analysis to senior executives and working as a business partner across all departments
Thrive in a complex, fast-paced environment

Desired Qualifications:

Experience in B2C subscription or SaaS business model
Experience with Host Analytics or Anaplan is a plus
Working knowledge of SEO and SEM
Experience with SiSense or other data visualization tools
SQL

About BOLD:

BOLD is a fast-paced, innovative company full of smart, committed people who are passionate about our products and love helping people find the career of their dreams. We balance work and fun while continuing to build a successful, fast-growing company that is changing the way people get jobs.

Our vision is to revolutionize the online career world by creating transformational products that help people find the careers they love and reach their full potential.

title: Financial Analyst
job_description:
Mavis Discount Tire Financial Analyst

Put your career into high gear with Mavis Discount Tire! We're looking for a full-time Financial Analyst to join Team Mavis at our Operations Support Center in Millwood, NY. With over 700 retail locations, Mavis is the one of the largest independently-held tire sales and automotive repair chain in the United States.

About the Position of Financial Analyst

As a member of the Analytics Department, the Financial Analyst will support the VP of Planning & Analysis develop and present actionable insights through the rigorous analysis of varied data sources

Requirements & Qualifications

 2-3 years of experience in data analytics Highly advanced Excel skills required Advanced financial modeling and forecasting experience Experience with processing and communicating data & business insights Familiarity with data visualization platforms such as Tableau a plus Experience with SQL databases a plus Excellent written presentation skills Strong ownership and demonstrated project management skills Strong verbal and written skills

Duties & Responsibilities

The analyst will assist the VP of Planning & Analysis in developing and presenting actionable insights to various audiences within the organization. Audiences may include Executive team, Inventory, Operations and Human Resources. The Analyst will be responsible for compiling data from disparate data repositories, and then organizing, evaluating and using data visualization tools to present the data for the purpose of providing actionable insights with a quantifiable impact on profitability. The Financial Analyst will also be instrumental in the preparation of financial models for annual budgets, tracking the business performance relative to model assumptions, and determining the source of variances.

Employee Benefits

At Mavis, we understand that our people drive our success. We provide our team members with competitive weekly pay, a good working environment and an excellent combination of additional benefits like health and dental insurance, a 401(k) retirement savings plan with employer match, paid vacations, paid personal and sick time, paid holidays, on-the-job training, and opportunities for career growth and advancement.

Mavis is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Consistent with our commitment to the principal of equal employment opportunity for all individuals, we enforce a zero tolerance policy on discrimination at Mavis. Employment decisions are made without regard to an applicant's or employee's actual or perceived membership in any category or status protected by applicable federal, state or local law. title: Quantitative Research Analyst - Experienced Hire
job_description:
OverviewSIG’s Quantitative Researchers find solutions to complex problems that occur in the world of trading. They use research as a tool to better understand global markets, varying products, and the network of exchanges on which we trade. Quants move SIG's business forward by improving, identifying, and implementing trading strategies for the firm.

In this role, you will examine global markets, utilize terabytes of trading data, and leverage your statistical analytic skills to build models and strategies for a variety of financial instruments. By using your quantitative and computational experience, you will help us increase profitability for the firm while decreasing our risk in the capital markets. Our collaborative environment enables you to work closely with traders and developers as you continuously advance the sophistication and results of your research. The impact of your work becomes quickly apparent as it affects our trading environment on a daily basis.What we're looking for

Ph D. or equivalent degree in Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Operations Research, or related disciplineStrong practical computing skills in object oriented languagesDemonstrated experience working with and drawing conclusions from large datasets

For more information, please contact/send your resume to Mike Pachella at mike.pachella@sig.com.

SIG is not accepting unsolicited resumes from search firms. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at SIG via-email, the Internet or directly without a valid written search agreement will be deemed the sole property of SIG, and no fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by SIG.

title: 2021 Investment Banking Summer Analyst (SF)
job_description:
Job DescriptionAbout JMP:

JMP Securities a premier middle-market investment bank headquartered in San Francisco, with offices in New York, Boston and Chicago. We offer our clients a complete range of investment banking and institutional equities capabilities across four high-growth sectors of the economy: technology, healthcare, financial services and real estate.

We raise capital for corporate clients, including equity and debt in public and private markets. We advise clients on mergers and acquisitions and other strategic initiatives. We have an equity research department that provides institutional investors with unique insights and a sales and trading platform that gives us an extensive distribution network for both our ideas and our securities offerings. JMP has approximately 200 employees and was founded in 2000.

Position Description:

JMP is seeking Investment Banking Summer Analysts to join their banking teams in New York and San Francisco for Summer 2021. The Summer Analyst will be involved in all facets of JMP's investment banking activities, including supporting private and public offerings, mergers and acquisitions, and other advisory services across a variety of industry groups. JMPs Summer Analysts often work directly with senior investment bankers and other banking team members, continually receiving an education in financial analysis, as well as a broad-based exposure to advisory and underwriting products.

The specific responsibilities of the Summer Analyst may include: financial analysis and modeling, company and industry research, coordination of various processes involved in a financing or sale, and preparation of offering memorandums, management presentations, pitches, proposals, and other materials for meetings with clientele.

The Summer Analyst will spend a portion of their internship completing an internal training program that highlights JMPs core products in each coverage group, and preparing an M&A summer project that culminates with a formal presentation to a panel of senior bankers.

Application Instructions: please apply for the office location you want to be considered for (NY or SF). To be considered for both locations, apply to either posting and indicate your preference when prompted (only apply ONCE).

Requirements

Targeting 2021 rising seniors scheduled to graduate by summer 2022Minimum GPA 3.5 (4.0 scale)Outstanding academic achievementSuccessful completion of, or enrollment in, finance and/or accounting course workProficiency with MS Word, Excel and PowerPointStrong leadership and teamwork skillsLive in, or ability to relocate to, San Francisco, CA for Summer 2021

Strong verbal and written communication skillsSuperior work ethic

Additional Details:

Paid InternshipRecruiting Timeline (tentative and subject to change)


Application Window: June 22 to July 31, 2020First / Second Round Interviews (phone): August 3 August 31, 2020Super Day (in-person or virtual): Week of September 14, 2020
Internship Program Dates: May 31 to July 23, 2021

JMP Securities is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Sr Structured Investment Analyst
job_description:
Looking to make a real difference?

You belong right here.

Come build a rewarding career helping others achieve their financial dream at an organization that values your own long-term success. With your unique talents, you have what it takes to be bold and brilliant in everything you do and reach new heights for a company dedicated to diversity and inclusion, community and you.

If you share that belief, this is where you belong.

Join our team of nearly 6,000 associates across 40 different locations worldwide and start your future today.

The position's primary focus is the review and analysis of current and prospective structured investments in support of the group's portfolio monitoring and new deal origination activities. Candidate will become increasingly involved in all aspects of the group's investments function, including trading of various structured securities (MBS/ABS/CMBS).

What you will do

Perform financial modeling on the group's existing securities portfolio (monthly reviews as prescribed by the group's portfolio monitoring guidelines using internal models), communicating the findings of such reviews to other senior analysts and/or the portfolio manager. Maintain a database for the group's monitoring history.Review and analyze collateral pools using a variety of models, including Bloomberg, Port and Intex. Complete trade tickets and trade entries to our securities accounting system for new and secondary issue securities. Review and learn the group's Investment Policy Guidelines.Review model results and reconcile with actuarial and accounting records.Duties may include trading relevant MBS Specified Pools and other structured investments depending on experienceOther duties as assigned, including assisting with Board investment summaries, quarterly reporting packages, credit ratings change memos, and other ad hoc reporting.

What you will bring

Candidate must possess at least a B.A. or B.S. degree in Finance, Economics or other Quantitative field or a C.F.A. designation with a non-business B.A. or B.S. degree. An MBA or M.S.

What will set you apart

3 – 5 years of relevant prior work experience. Without a business degree, candidate must possess at least three years of additional directly related work experience.A strong skill set in Excel spreadsheet based modeling is desired.Familiarity with Bloomberg and Intex is a plus.
Normal business hours.
Overnight travel is possible.

We are an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to diversity. All individuals, regardless of personal characteristics, are encouraged to apply. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

title: Financial Analyst
job_description:
Secure our Nation, Ignite your Future

Become an integral part of a diverse team while working at an Industry Leading Organization, where our employees come first. At ManTech International Corporation, youll help protect our national security while working on innovative projects that offer opportunities for advancement.

Currently, ManTech is seeking a motivated, career and customer-oriented Financial Analyst to join our team in the Arlington, VA.

Provide financial reporting and reconciliation support to the Department of Defense (DoD) Chemical and Biological Defense Program (CBDP) located in Arlington, VA. Ideally the you should have experience working in a collaborative environment, be a self-starter and able to work independently. You will be responsible for the reconciliation of financial account balances and financial statements; identifying, researching, analyzing, and resolving account discrepancies; and providing assistance to the audit support team.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

• Generating financial reports and ad hoc queries from GFEBS, DAI, and ADVANA.

• Downloading and reviewing various reports generated from the DDRS.

• Responding to inquiries/questions from FIAR and DFAS related to financial reporting.

• Reviewing CBDP Quarterly Financial Statements and Footnotes prepared by DFAS.

• Reviewing CBDP Quarterly ADVANA UoT Workbooks generated from ADVANA tool.

• Supporting and uploading PBC items (if needed) into the FIAR Audit Response Center (ARC).

• Preparing various Journal Vouchers.

• Performing various Reconciliations.

• Providing support to remediate Notice of Findings (NFR).

• Providing support and tracking Corrective Action Plans (CAPs) Milestones.

• Reviewing and updating Financial Reporting Process Narratives and SOPs.

• Supporting Entity Level Control (ELC) documentations (as necessary)

• Researching accounting issues and preparing white papers.

• Providing support to ensure Agency compliance with current financial management and accounting requirements and reforming initiatives, such as Federal Accounting Standards Advisory Board (FASAB) accounting statements/concepts, OMB circulars and bulletins, OSD Comptroller guidance, the DoD Financial Management Regulation, and other Federal/DoD requirements.

• Providing finance and accounting data call information to internal DTRA customers, independent auditors, and external customers (e.g., DFAS, OSD, OMB, DoD Inspector General (DoD IG)).

• Assisting in the analysis of DTRA accounts and recommend preparation of adjusting journal entries.

• Assisting in validating adjusted entries to ensure financial statement and account balance data is accurate.

• Assisting in gathering and analyzing government wide Trading Partner transactions data.

Basic Qualifications:

• 5 or more years of directly related experience.

• Bachelors Degree (Accounting or Finance preferred).

• Experience with Microsoft Excel and Word.

• Experience with SOP/narrative creation and revision.

• Experience reconciling large amounts of data.

Preferred Qualifications:

• CPA, CGFM, or CDFM Preferred.

• Experience with DoD or ODO preferred but any government experience(s).

• Experience with GFEBS and DAI preferred but any other government system(s).

Security Clearance Requirements:

• Must be a U.S. Citizen with an Active Secret Security clearance or higher.

Physical Requirements:

• Must be able to remain in a stationary position 50% of the time.

• The person in this position frequently communicates with co-workers, management and customers, which may involve delivering presentations. Must be able to exchange accurate information in these situations.

• The person in this position needs to occasionally move about inside the office.

• The person in this position will need to be able to operate a computer and other office productivity machinery, such as a calculator, copy machine and computer printer.
