title: CENTRAL SUPERVISION ANALYST
job_description:
SUMMARY

The Central Supervision Analyst assists the Central Supervision Manager/Supervisor in their supervisory review function for assigned Branch Managers and Financial Advisors of the Central Supervision Department. The Analyst assists the Supervisors in all aspects of their job with the intent upon passing required licenses to progress to the next level.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Assist Central Supervision Supervisor in their review of accounts appearing on Monthly Scorecards. Prepare Account Questionnaires to be completed by the FA as needed.Assist in the review of monthly detail statements. Contact the branch to verify information as needed.Assist in the review of employee outside accounts.Contact branch staff to educate them on policies and procedures related to acceptable check deposits.Follow up with branch staff on requests for information generated during ProSurv reviews.Gather information useful in reviewing/responding to account inquiries and requests for action initiated by Compliance.Gather information useful in reviewing any potential concerns regarding specific account or FA activity.Travel by car and/or air in conjunction with local, regional and/or national travel may be required.

QUALIFICATIONS

B.S. or B.A. in Financial field or equivalent education and experience combination required.1-3 years’ Branch Operations or Branch Manager experience required.Series 7 required; Series 63 or 66 and Insurance License within 6 months of hire required.Knowledge of principles and processes for providing customer and personal services. This includes customer needs assessment, meeting quality standards for services, and evaluation of customer satisfaction.

ABOUT STIFEL

Established in 1890, Stifel is one of the nation’s leading full-service wealth management and investment banking firms. Stifel serves clients from more than 400 offices across the United States and ranks as the nation’s seventh largest full-service investment firm in terms of number of financial advisors. We are also a leading provider of investment banking services to the middle market, a top-ten municipal bond underwriter, and home to one of the industry’s largest research franchises. In addition our Stifel Bank subsidiary provides a comprehensive range of banking services.

At Stifel we offer an entrepreneurial environment, comprehensive benefits package to include health, dental and vision care, 401k, wellness initiatives, life insurance, and paid time off.

Stifel is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Senior Accountant and Analyst
job_description: The Longboat Group is a diversified family-office that values integrity, creativity, and a principled approach to business. Comprised of an outstanding team of professionals, The Longboat Group strives for excellence and continuous improvement across its business holdings.  These include:  • CitySide – CitySide is an exciting urban apartment community in downtown Sarasota, Florida which has pioneered a unique high-service, luxury-amenity rental model. CitySide has been recognized not only as a leader in apartment living in Sarasota, but among all rental properties nationwide.  • The Bayside Club – A forthcoming resort-style apartment community in downtown Sarasota, Florida which will expand on the success of CitySide.  • Longboat Property Management – The property management team is comprised of specialists in the areas of resident experience, operations, and building maintenance. We pride ourselves on delivering passionate, engaging, and efficient service.  • Longboat Capital - Responsible, thoughtful investing with a focus on building lasting value has always been Longboat Capital’s hallmark. Longboat Capital’s history is rooted in its origins as a family office and investment management firm, primarily focusing on market-type investments, including hedge and real estate funds. Longboat Capital continues to maintain a diversified portfolio of investments with an emphasis on real estate holdings.  General Summary:  The Senior Accountant and Analyst is responsible for making all Accounts Receivable and Accounts Payable general journal entries, performing general accounting functions, reporting on financials, reviewing data for accuracy, observing and managing short-term cash needs and analyzing budget variances. The Senior Accountant and Analyst must comply with legal requirements and regulations, term agreements, and tax rules. Budget preparation and facilitation is also an essential element for the Senior Accountant and Analyst. The Senior Accountant and Analyst must interact with individuals at all levels and must exhibit effective communication skills and be able to work under pressure, meeting all deadlines. The Senior Accountant and Analyst should also be a self-motivator, be able to work independently, quickly solve problems and complete tasks, and take initiative when needed. Perform office management responsibilities and other duties as assigned. This position will report to the Chief Operating Officer and work closely with each business entity’s manager.  Essential Functions for assigned Entities:  Accounting  • Perform all general accounting functions for assigned entities such as, but not limited to, all general journal entities, monthly accruals, and maintaining accurate financial records.  • Facilitate and complete monthly close procedures according to agreed-upon calendar.  • Review invoices from vendors, match with appropriate documents, ensure they are recorded to appropriate account and entity, ensure appropriate approvals are obtained, and ensure payment is made within the term of the invoice.  • Prepare and manage the 1099/1096 tax requirements and ensure that we receive W-9 forms from vendors.  • Invoice customers/clients as needed, track and resolve outstanding payment issues, communicate collection issues and status to the appropriate management personnel on a monthly basis.  • Maintain accounts payable and accounts receivable accounts, while communicating aged accounts to the Chief Operating Officer.  • Analyze general ledger accounts and run financial statements, at the request of management, while clearly communicating financial results and performance to operational personnel.  • Coordinate assets depreciation schedule and activity.  Reporting & Analysis  • Prepare monthly, quarterly, and yearly management reports and accompanying schedules and narratives, according to the monthly closing schedule. Provide follow-up and documentation of significant variances.  • Review revenue to ensure that it is accurate.  • Coordinate tax audits and tax returns with external tax firm.  • Review and analyze financial data from Real Page and prepare financial reports related to a 228-unit apartment building.  • Manage and prepare annual budgets.  • Use financial data to predict trends and make recommendations to senior management.  • Analyze recurring expenditures and revenue for increased cost recovery and efficiency opportunities.  Finance  • Prepare initial financial and budget analysis of each entity and asset value.  • Proactively analyze financial trends and assist in providing data for Asset Management Plans.  Banking/Cash  • Reconcile all investment accounts.  • Manage cash needs.  • Perform a monthly investment report, based upon performance of hedge funds and other investments.  • Make bank deposits.  Requirements:  1. At least five years of progressive experience in accounting. A degree in Business Management and/or Accounting preferred.  2. Advanced experience in QuickBooks, Excel and Word.  3. Strong analytical, organizational, time management, interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills.  4. Conformation to quality and accountability in all aspects of work performance, high ethical and professional standards, and takes initiative towards improvement of deliverables.  5. Strong problem resolution skills and a demonstrated ability to pay high attention to details.  6. Must be able to effectively handle multiple entities simultaneously in a deadline driven environment.  7. Individual will be expected to work with minimal management oversight and take ownership of his/her work product.  8. Real estate and small office experience are preferred, but not required.  HOW TO APPLY  Please send a cover letter, resume, salary history, and salary requirements.  The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of the work being performed by people assigned to this job. They are not an exhausted list of all duties, responsibilities and working conditions associated with the job.  Longboat Capital Management, LLC is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Financial Advisor
job_description:
Financial Advisor Job Description
Required Licenses:

Series 6 or 7
Series 63 and 65 or 66
Life and Health Insurance
Ability to pass Government Security Clearance
Bachelor’s degree

Preferred: 

CFP® or the ability to obtain it in the future
Experience in a bank, credit union or non-profit.
Experience working with federal government employees
Experience with MoneyGuidePro (Financial Planning software) and Morningstar Workstation (Portfolio Analysis tool) a plus!

Primary Functions
While the self-generation of leads and cold calling is not generally needed as GEBA is able to provide a large volume of leads- you will be required to conduct seminars or participate in public relations events as necessary.
The Financial Advisor meets with current and prospective members, to collect and discuss each member’s life insurance and financial information (assets, income, debt, cash flow, tax status, retirement saving and financial objectives).
The Financial Advisor analyzes the information collected to develop individualized advice and strategies for each client based upon each client’s insurance and financial status, risk tolerance, needs and objectives.
The Financial Advisor will provide individualized advice and recommendation on the purchase of life insurance and Investments that are in the client’s best interest. The Advisor will make sales of these recommended life insurance and investment products.
Financial Advisors will be expected to periodically reach out to clients to review their accounts or to suggest a review of their account.
Secondary functions
Advisors will also be expected to provide customer service for GEBA’s $260,000,000 of legacy fixed products which includes a Stable Value Account, Group Variable Annuity and Group Fixed Annuity as well as act as contributing member of the GEBA team in any capacity necessary to benefit the organization. Cold calling is not a general practiced at GEBA, but outgoing phone calls are required.
Travel:
Very little travels is required. Typically less than twice per year.
About GEBA and GEBA Wealth Management
Government Employees Benefit Association is a not for profit Voluntary Benefit Association dedicated to assisting our membership.
GEBA Wealth Management manages more than $300,000,000 in assets and more than 17,000 members (2600 holding investments with us). We have grown rapidly since then and need to add personnel to keep up with demand. We take helping our membership fulfill their insurance and financial needs seriously, which is why we do not base our compensation around commission.
Compensation: This is salary-based position with production-based incentives
Benefits:

Subsidized Dental
Subsidized Vision
Subsidized Health
Short Term Disability (100% covered)
Long Term Disability (100% covered)
11 Paid Holidays
5% Dollar for Dollar 401K Match
20 days of Paid Time Off (Starting)
100K of Life Insurance (100% covered)
Tuition Reimbursement
Additional Benefit Information will be provided during the interview process

title: Banking, Capital Markets and Advisory (BCMA) - Investment Banking, Summer Analyst - Houston
job_description:
You're ready to bring your knowledge from the classroom to the boardroom and Citi wants to help you get there. Whether it's honing your skills or building your network, we know that success can't come without growth. Our programs equip you with the knowledge and training you need to play a valuable role on your team and establish a long-term career here. At Citi, we value internal mobility, and career growth is not a question of if, but when. Citi's Institutional Clients Group (ICG) is looking for Summer Analysts to join the Investment Banking team in NAM. The Investment Banking group provides sector expertise and strategy advisory solutions, including mergers & acquisitions, capital raising and other strategic financings to corporate, financial service and public sector clients.

Your time here will look something like this...

Collect and analyze company information to assist transactions; including conducting industry research, revising, and organizing financial data
Analyze financial data and develop financial models including company valuations, discounted cash flow analysis, financing, and comparative analyses
Create and finalize new business development presentations
Coordinate tasks with internal and external working teams
Prepare required internal documentation e.g. control and compliance regulations

We provide you with the knowledge and skills you need to succeed.

We're committed to teaching you the ropes. The 10 week Summer Analyst Program starts in June and begins with a 1 week in-depth training program. After a placement process, based on your interests and our needs, you will be matched with an Investment Banking team to work with for the duration of the Program. While you're in the Summer Analyst role, you're eligible to participate in Citi's mentorship program, which will provide further training and guidance during and after the Program. Top performing Summer Analysts often return to Citi after graduation to work as Full Time Analysts.

We want to hear from you if...

You are graduating between December 2021 and June 2022 and have a preferred GPA of 3.5 or above

Who we think will be a great fit...

A dedication to learning and a true passion for the business are vital. As industries all over the globe continue to restructure and grow. We are hiring professionals who have a global perspective on the future of banking and want to make an impact on the corporate level. We value diversity and so do you. We'll also be looking for the following:



Commitment to personal growth and career development
A strong desire to learn and succeed in team environments
Knowledge of the global or domestic business landscape is a plus, but not required
Strong communication, planning, and organizational skills
Passion for client service and a dedication to deliver the best results on every project
Desire to develop a deep understanding of the financial industry
Unquestioned commitment to integrity and ethical decision-making

title: Senior Financial Analyst FP&A
job_description:
The Senior Financial Analyst is a key contributor in developing and driving value added analytics to assist in the growth of the TaylorMade business. This strategically minded and detail-oriented individual will identify opportunities using analytics and data management. S/he will partner with finance colleagues to develop accurate plans and forecasts; also adept in the use of financial analytics, investment analysis and database management tools to identify trends and opportunities which add value to our business. One of the key focus areas of this role is driving enterprise cash flow forecasting (including monthly cash flow statement, balance balance sheet investments) and enhancing/improving our ability to forecast cash flow.

Essential Functions and Key Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain financial models and analyses in support of strategic planning and decision making as well as financial performance relative to business plans.Key contributor in developing Annual Operating Plan (AOP) and support 5-year strategic plans in conjunction with managers and business partners for assigned areas.Prepare and present monthly management reporting. Thoroughly understands reporting, provides key analysis of financial results, and communicates risks/opportunities.Analyze data and create financial models to provide comprehensive and accurate information to support and influence decisions and drive achievement of business goals.Works with business and functional units to prepare and submit monthly global cash flow statement forecasts (FTM) and other cash and borrowing projection models.Provide monthly analysis of FTM actuals on the following: Forecast/AOP variances, risks & opportunities to forecast and vs AOP. Coordinates with teams to identify and mitigate variances.Participate and understand all capital authorization requests (CER’s) and asset procurement with a focus on cash flow for all assigned areas. Liaise with VP Finance, Supply Chain on overall management of enterprise capital spending.Collaborate with inventory management team and to ensure accurate forecasting and tracking of net working capital.Manage the link between FTM, P&L and Balance Sheet so that all statements align for internal and external reporting.Support Treasury team with business cash flow needs, risks, and opportunities. Work with Treasury to strengthen linkages between monthly FTM (Cash Flow Statement) forecasting and 13-week cash flow forecasting.Identify and drive process improvements within FPA team. Develop processes, tools, and dashboards to continually improve forecast accuracy. Participate with teams to proactively identify and evaluate cost-saving opportunities.Performs other related duties and assignments as required.

Knowledge and Skills Requirements:

Strong analytical (quantitative as well as qualitative) skillsDemonstrated ability to gather and analyze large amounts of data at a macro and micro levelSolid understanding of accounting (specifically how to build cash flow statements), budgeting and financial statement principles, concepts, and analysisAdvanced ability in use of financial systems and data analytics/data visualization software (MS Office, PBCS, Oracle EBS, Business Objects, DOMO, Tableau)Proven ability to multi-task, work under pressure, and meet tight deadlinesSelf-starter with the ability to streamline functions and passion to learn and growConfident in presentation skills; Ability to effectively present financial information from multiple sources in a concise and clear manner. Thrives in fast-paced, growing, rapidly changing environmentStrong ability to work independently and collaborate with multi-functional teams

Education, Work Experience, and Professional Certifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Finance or Accounting5-8 years of relevant experience in a corporate FP&A environmentExperience in investment banking experience preferred.Experience with golf, sporting goods manufacturer/retailer or similar consumer goods industry is a plus.

Work Environment / Physical Requirements:

Normal office conditions with extensive computer and phone usageAbility to work extended hours as necessary, including phone meetings with international offices.Able to work efficiently and accurately in an atmosphere of frequent interruptionLight physical effort equal to frequent lifting or moving of lightweight materials

TaylorMade Golf Company is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religious creed, color, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, pregnancy, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, sexual orientation, military and veteran status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance, or regulation.

title: Public Finance Investment Banking Analyst
job_description:
Public Finance Investment Banking Analyst


Location



MN - Minneapolis (Headquarters)


Business Area



Public Finance Investment Banking


Employment Type



Full Time




Piper Sandler is a leading, international middle-market investment bank and institutional securities firm. Our public finance professionals specialize in state and local government, derivatives, education, healthcare, hospitality and senior living. We are committed to participating in the communities we serve which is why we have a presence in 34 areas across the country. We are actively seeking an analyst to support our Charter School and Senior Living teams in Minneapolis, MN.

Analysts provide analytical and quantitative support and assist senior bankers to provide investment banking service to clients in the public sector. At Piper Sandler, analysts are an integral part of the financing team and assume a high level of responsibilities and actively participate in all aspects of the transactions.

An analyst’s typical responsibilities include:

· Developing financial models to structure and optimize transactions

· Preparing analyses on client capital structure, debt capacity and credit profile

· Drafting responses to request for proposals by clients

· Preparing presentations for financing proposals and new business development

· Interacting with internal and external financing team members in developing, executing and closing of a transaction

Applicant Qualifications:

· B.S. or B.A. with major(s) in business, economics, public administration or related fields is preferred

· Successful candidates will be highly self-motivated and willing to work long hours when needed

· Excellent analytical and quantitative skills are a must and good understanding of financial markets is expected

· Well organized, attention to detail and able to manage multiple projects under pressure

· Advanced user of Excel, PowerPoint and Word

· Strong communication and professional presence with clients required

title: R&D MDA Space Knowledge Center SME/System Research Analyst (Experienced)
job_description:
:

Are you passionate about your work and dream of utilizing state-of-the-art concepts to explore solutions? Do you want to join a dynamic team that solves significant issues for our nation's security? If so, we invite you to explore this new and exciting opportunity within Sandias Applied Technology Support Department.

We are actively seeking a highly motivated Engineer to assist the Missile Defense Agency (MDA) in assessing, planning, and analyzing future threats, requirements, architectures and technologies, particularly those in the space domain. As the successful candidate, you will be embedded with the Missile Defense Agency in the National Capital Region (NCR). You will interact daily with senior MDA leadership, represent Sandia National Laboratories and its capabilities to MDA leadership, as well as, present complex technical topics in a simple manner to non-technical government decision makers. As it is a remote assignment, you will be self-motivated and possess a can-do attitude in seeking new opportunities for making technical contributions. A current Top Secret clearance with SCI and experience working with the Department of Defense at senior levels are requirements for this position.

Required:


You have a bachelors or advanced degree in Engineering, plus a minimum of 10 years directly related experience.
You possess knowledge of U.S. Space and Missile Defense capabilities
Your background includes experience working with/presenting to DoD senior leaders
You possess 5 years experience with space-related technologies (satellites, sensors, rockets, and related technologies)
Ability to work remotely from the primary work location in Washington, D.C.
Ability to travel as required
You have a current DoD TS or DOE Q clearance with ability to obtain an SCI, which typically requires a polygraph

Desired:

Ideally, your background will also include:


Advanced degree in Engineering
10 years experience or more working with space-related technologies
5 or more years experience working directly in DoD development and/or acquisition programs
Experience leading and working within integrated multi-disciplinary teams
Experience working with advanced technologies, delivering responsive technical solutions in anticipation of Missile Defense or Space mission needs, and facilitating the integration and sustainment of operational capabilities
Experience collaborating with UARCs (i.e. Johns Hopkins APL) and FFRDCs (i.e. DOE laboratories, MIT Lincoln Laboratory, Aerospace Corporation)
Experience developing complex space or missile defense hardware, software, and firmware
Systems Engineering, Planning, and Analysis
Integrated Test and Evaluation

Department Description:

The Applied Technology Support department, 5413, provides multi-disciplinary embedded technology support at offsite customer locations focusing on innovative weapon systems analyses, design, and mission systems performance for national security mission areas with personnel capable of providing subject matter expertise. The Department supports Strategic Partners needs/requirements by aligning with Sandias capabilities.

About Sandia:

Sandia National Laboratories is the nations premier science and engineering lab for national security and technology innovation, with teams of specialists focused on cutting-edge work in a broad array of areas. Some of the main reasons we love our jobs:


Challenging work withamazingimpact that contributes to security, peace, and freedom worldwide
Extraordinary co-workers
Some of the best tools, equipment, and research facilities in the world
Career advancement and enrichment opportunities
Flexible schedules, generous vacations,strongmedical and other benefits, competitive 401k, learning opportunities, relocation assistance and amenities aimed at creating a solid work/life balance\

title: Financial Analyst
job_description: OVERVIEWANSER enhances national and homeland security by strengthening public institutions. We provide thought leadership for complex issues through independent analysis and we deliver practical, useful solutions. ANSER values collaboration, integrity, and initiative and we are client focused in all that we do. We were established for the purpose of public service and not for profit, we measure our success in the impact of our service.SPECIFIC JOB DESCRIPTIONANSER is seeking a Financial Analyst to assist the DoD CIO. Responsibilities include:* Analyze financial data related to operations, business performance, opportunities, and investments.* Familarity with analyzing budgets and other financial data* Support the Planning, Programming, Budgeting, and Execution (PPBE) process within DoD CIO by reviewing budget Program Objectives Memorandum (POM) submissions and correlating the submissions to strategy and or funding requirements.* Conduct analysis of the DoD IT and Cyberspace Activities budget artifacts (SNAP-IT budget; investment descriptions, categorization of service and agency efforts to investment descriptions, Congressional Budget Justifications, budget baselines, etc.)* Support process improvements by documeting areas needing more clarifty* Assist in writing, editing, and justifying policy document language for cybersecurity capabilitiesEDUCATION AND EXPERIENCEAdvanced degree in a discipline relevant to the position; or bachelors degree plus at least 5 years relevant professional experience.SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE* Must have an active Top Secret Clearance / SCI* Cognizant of current DoD budgetary principles and their associated operational impact* Familiarity with Program Objective Memorandum (POM) submission process with DoD organizations and or Military services.* Demonstrated experience working with military components or other DoD agencies IT or cyberspace activities budget* Experience working with budget databases to include DRDW, SNAP-IT, and or PRCP.* Experience within DoD Appropriations and budget documents.* Excellent written communication skills* Expert level user of Microsoft Office Professional Software SuiteDISCLAIMER:In compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act Amendment Act (ADAAA), if you have a disability and would like to request an accommodation in order to apply for a position with ANSER, please call 703-416-2000 or e-mail Recruiting@anser.org.ANSER is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We seek individuals from a broad variety of backgrounds with varying levels of experience who have a desire to do meaningful work. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote regardless of race, color, gender, religion, national origin, ancestry, disability, age, veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Insurance/Financial Advisor
job_description: Who we are: Lenox Advisors is a premier wealth and insurance advisory firm providing solutions for high net worth individuals and their families. We are professional fiduciaries with an entrepreneurial spirit. For our professionals, that means keeping our clients at the center of everything we do while also maintaining a collegial and collaborative environment in which everyone can contribute, develop relationships and further build their business. With a national footprint, Lenox is continually looking for ambitious, experienced Sales Professionals, who will be responsible for developing new client opportunities across the wealth management spectrum including insurance, asset management, risk management, estate planning, retirement planning, children’s college education, etc.What you’ll be doing:Proactively establish, develop and maintain strong client relationships through regular contact and by providing timely, value-added information, advice and recommendations.Engage with several new and existing clients every day to understand their long term goals and objectives and their short term needs, present customized recommendations, offer advice and complete sales.Build client loyalty by providing an exceptional client experience through delivering trusted advice resulting in earned referrals from your clients and friends.Network regularly with existing clients and referrals in order to build relationships and gain referral business.Be your clients’ main point of contact and accountable for responding to their questions and concerns.Be part of a broader team all working together to build client loyalty through a “one team” approach.What we’re looking for:The Lenox brand represents a caring, creative and passionate family of professionals. It’s important that your values align to ours – trust, team work and accountability.A passion for client service. You enjoy talking with clients and are interested in getting to know them and helping them achieve their goals.Well-developed interpersonal and communication skills including the ability to quickly engage and connect, actively listen, empathize, ask questions and respond in language that clients understand.Well-developed relationship building and presentation skills sufficient to convey detailed information requiring interpretation to highly knowledgeable clients, professionals and business groups within the community.Developed knowledge of insurance and investment solutions.Minimum two to five years of experience in sales with a proven track record.State Variable Life & Health License and FINRA licensing including Series 6 or Series 7, Series 63.

title: Financial Analyst
job_description:
Financial Analyst

Washington, DC

Responsibilities:


Validate the Naval Shipyard (NSY) annual workload (direct/overhead) and cost requirement via NSY capability plans.
NSY Issue Papers: Support the standardization, collection, staffing, tracking, adjudication, alignment with stakeholder partners, and submittal to OPNAV N83 in support of the Planning, Programming, Budgeting, and Execution (PPBE) process.
Conduct data analysis of all NSY metrics to identify trends. Areas include; workload, staffing, cost, direct vs indirect requirements, shipyard performance, and others.
Develop SEA04X corporate documents, i.e. Business Plan, Annual Report, and others.
Programming Adjustments and Risk Factor Working Groups (RFWG): Assist SEA04X in the execution and analysis of the RFWG and Programming Adjustment efforts, as well as developing documentation for those processes.
Update other documents as necessary, i.e. standard operating procedures or informal processes

Requirements:


BA or BS degree
US Citizen with Secret Security Clearance
Heavy data analytics skills to include advanced knowledge of excel (i.e. programming macros, pivot tables, visualizations), and analyzing large data for understanding trends, developing hypotheses, and formulating conclusions.



In-depth knowledge of President’s Budget Information System (PBIS) to include in-depth knowledge of Program Elements pertaining to Ship Depot Maintenance, developing queries, understanding various working tables, and extracting issues.
Have advanced knowledge of Tableau Desktop program as a User/Developer.


A subject matter expert on drafting responses to requests for inquiry from activities such as Congress, Congressional Budget Office (CBO), Government Accountability Office (GAO), OPNAV, Fleets, NAVSEA leadership, etc. Response format will be in both power point and Microsoft word. 



To support these responses, employee should have the ability to collect, compile, and analyze data.
Excellent technical writing skills, proficient in all MS Suite Tools (i.e. Word, Powerpoint, One Note) to be able to develop briefs, white papers, and technical reports.



ORBIS offers an excellent benefits package and competitive salary in a professional atmosphere.

title: Financial Analyst

title: Supply Chain Financial Analyst
job_description:
Maxar is currently seeking a Financial Analyst to join our team in Palo Alto, CA or San Jose, CA. In this role, you will work with our Supply Chain team to help them support the next stage of their growth. You will manage and oversee day-to-day Supply Chain financial processes, including non-labor budget vs. actual variances, cash outflow forecasting, cost/price analysis, new business proposal non labor details, small business subcontracting reporting, and various other key business analysis. You will work closely with Supply Chain staff and management, Finance, Accounting, and New Business teams.

Responsibilities:

Work with Subcontract Administrators (SCAs)/Buyers to oversee forecasting all non-labor spend and cash outflow requirements

Maintain various non labor reports such as Spend, Commitment, Termination for Convenience schedules, budget vs. actual variances, cost savings, program unique government reporting requirements, etc.

Perform variance analysis of spending, using this analysis to identify risk and opportunities and potential future savings opportunities

Interface and coordinate with Accounting and Finance on various non labor cash, revenue and budget reports and inputs

Work with new business teams establishing and updating non labor pricing model and proposals, creating new business non labor cash outflows and other necessary inputs

Work with SCAs/Buyers on negotiation strategies and price/cost analysis to comply with Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR) and U.S. Government Cost Accounting Standards (CAS)

Collect small business subcontracting statistics in support of proposals and periodic reports

Support directorate compliance to U.S. Government Truthful Cost and Pricing Requirements/TINA

Support special projects and process improvements within Supply Chain and Finance

Minimum Requirements:

Must be a U.S. citizen or permanent resident

Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Business, Supply Chain, or relevant area. Four additional years of experience may be substituted for a degree

Minimum of 5 years of overall experience, with at least 3 years in a Financial Analyst role 

Superior analytical skills, combined with excellent business judgment and strong ability to clearly and concisely communicate with senior management level personnel

Very strong skills with Excel and other MS office applications

Experience with IFS, Oracle 

Active team player and works well under pressure

Organized, detail oriented individual with ability to multi-task and maintain accuracy of information

Integrity with confidential information

Creativity in solving complex problems

Ability to work independently in support of team objectives

Preferred Qualifications:

Financial analysis experience in a manufacturing environment

Experience with Anaplan

Cost/Price analysis experience at a Government contractor and/or manufacturing business

Experience with Earned Value Management Systems (EVMS) that comply with ANSI/EIA-748

Familiarity with U.S. Government Cost Accounting Standards (CAS)

Experience with compliance to U.S. Government Truthful Cost and Pricing Requirements/TINA

title: Analyst, Investment Banking – Capital Markets
job_description:
We are passionate about our business and our culture, and are seeking individuals with that same drive.

Our Capital Markets Advisory Group structures and executes customized financing solutions and advises clients on all aspects of public and private debt and equity transactions. Financing solutions for our clients address a broad range of uses, including buyouts, growth capital, platform formation, refinancings, restructurings, recapitalizations, and project financing. In IPOs, we provide guidance on preparation, advice on key decisions and manage the syndicate banks. Our independence and objectivity, coupled with our direct and long-standing institutional buy-side relationships, inform our market views and strengthen the quality of our execution, leading to successful transactions for our clients. Debt products include ABL, term loans, DIP/exit financing, investment grade, high yield, mezzanine and unitranche. Equity products include structured equity, platform company financing, private investments in public equity (PIPEs), corporate and portfolio recapitalizations, IPO advisory and public company and Board of Directors advisory. The Group engages in direct dialogue with a wide range of institutional investors, including private equity, venture capital, hedge funds, alternative asset managers, bank and non-bank lenders, sovereign and pension funds and family offices.

Primary responsibilities include:

Work as instrumental part of the firm’s dedicated Capital Markets team to execute a full range of financial and strategic debt and equity transactions across both private and public advisory mandatesAssess a company’s optimal capitalization and sources of incremental capitalPerform valuation and capital structure analysesConstruct financial models to forecast and analyze pro forma effects of transaction structuresParticipate in client meetings and conduct due diligence sessionsPrepare company marketing materials, and accompany management teams on investor roadshowsParticipate in deal structuring and negotiation (including qualitative and quantitative analysis and presentation of alternatives) and legal documentationDevelop relationships and knowledge of buy-side investor universeDraft group presentations and capital market updates

Qualifications:

Undergraduate degree preferably in a business-related disciplineAt least one year relevant Investment Banking experienceKnowledge of business, economics and/or finance through education or experience Strong technical/computer skills (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, relevant market data services)Strong analytical, quantitative and organizational skillsExcellent written and oral communicationClient oriented approach

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants are considered for employment opportunities without regard to race, age, religion, color, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, political affiliation, citizenship status, genetic information, disability (in compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act and any other applicable law), or any other characteristic or status protected under any applicable US, state or other law.

title: Sr. Financial Analyst in Chicago, IL at True Value
job_description:

title: Consumer Investments Financial Solutions Advisor - Midway Financial Center - St. Paul, MN
job_description:
Job Description:

At Bank of America, we’re guided by a common purpose to help make financial lives better by connecting clients and communities to the resource they need to be successful. Make a difference where it counts by joining our industry-leading wealth management team at Bank of America and Merrill Lynch. We’re looking for the next generation of financial advisors—those with a passion for people and drive to make clients’ financial lives better. Going beyond portfolios and investment strategies, you’ll consider a client’s entire, complex financial picture, and then guide them with advice and solutions to help them live their best financial lives.

The Advisor Development Program will help provide you with the necessary training and guidance through a defined path to become the financial advisor you want to be. From marketing yourself to managing your own practice, we’ll equip you with everything you need as you move through the stages of development. The Financial Center Financial Solutions Advisor role is a pivotal entry point for experienced advisors looking to grow in a world-class organization. At this stage, you’ll fully immerse yourself in the financial lives of our clients, while building strong relationships across Bank of America. As your career grows, you’ll be exposed to new and exciting products, platforms and tools to help you serve your clients and deliver exceptional care.

This position is subject to SAFE Act registration requirements. Pursuant to the SAFE Act requirements, all employees engaged in residential loan mortgage originations must register with the federal registry system and remain in good standing. Since your position requires SAFE Act registration, you will be required to register and to submit to the required SAFE Act background check and registration process. Failure to obtain and/or maintain SAFE Act registration may result in your immediate termination.

We’ll help you

• Get training and one-on-one mentorship from managers who are invested in your success. You’ll enroll in our Academy for Consumer and Small Business to develop as an advisor; the potential for growth is yours!

• Build connections to grow your network and business. Leverage our relationships with one out of two U.S. households. Starting at a financial center, you’ll interact with banking clients, small business owners and higher net worth clients alike. You’ll also tap into a range of experts, from mortgage lenders to investment analysts.

• Provide end-to-end comprehensive advice. Deliver client reviews/presentations with confidence, including reviews of financial goals, and recommend strategies to help clients achieve their financial goals.

• Learn about the full suite of financial solutions. Connect clients to all of the solutions we provide, including core Banking, Investment & Life Priority™ solutions, through Bank of America and Merrill Lynch to meet their financial needs.

As an advisor, you can look forward to

• Unlimited potential for professional growth.

• A strong referral network from across the business to increase opportunities for client acquisition and provide access to partners who are specialists in their field.

• Robust marketing strategies to reach wider audiences with greater appeal.

• Ongoing professional development to deepen your skills and optimize your practice as the industry evolves.

• Leadership opportunities, including leading client and conference seminars and mentoring junior associates.

You’re a person who (required skills)

• Currently holds Series 7 & 66 (63 & 65 in lieu of 66) licenses. If you do not currently hold the 66 but have either a 63 or 65, an offer can be extended with the condition that a passing score is received for the missing series within 60 days.

• Has at least one year experience in the investments industry, including investment training and in-depth knowledge of investment products and services.

• Has at least one year experience working in the financial service industry and/or a sales environment where goals were met or exceeded.

• Sets and accomplishes goals, achieving whatever you put your mind to.

• Builds and nurtures strong relationships.

• Collaborates effectively with others to get things done.

• Communicates effectively and confidently and is comfortable engaging all clients.

• Manages goals, navigates complexity, prioritizes tasks and executes in a fast-paced environment.

• Likes to learn, adapts to new information and seeks the right solutions for clients.

• Efficiently manages your time and capacity.

• Is thorough and thoughtful in incorporating relevant regulatory due diligence into daily activities and long-term strategies for clients.

You’ll be better prepared if you have (desired skills)

• Strong computer skills and the ability to multitask in a demanding environment.

• A bachelor’s degree, preferably in business-related field.

• At least three years’ experience working in the financial service industry and/or a sales environment where goals were met or exceeded.

• Achieved additional professional designations such as Certified Financial Planner (CFP) and/or Chartered Retirement Planning Counselor (CRPC).

• Obtained your insurance licenses.

We’re a culture that

• Is committed to building a workplace where every employee is welcomed and given the support and resources to build and advance their careers. Along with taking care of our clients we want to be a great place for people to work, and we strive to create an environment where all employees have the opportunity to achieve their goals.

• Believes diversity makes us stronger so we can reflect, connect to and meet the diverse needs of our clients around the world.

• Provides continuous training and developmental opportunities to help employees achieve their goals, whatever their background or experience.

• Is committed to advancing our tools, technology, and ways of working. We always put our clients first to meet their evolving needs.

• Believes in responsible growth and is dedicated to supporting communities around the world by connecting them to the lending, investing and giving they need to remain vibrant and vital.

Shift:1st shift (United States of America)Hours Per Week:40
Learn more about this role





Transcript

 ✕

At Bank of America, I get to make a difference every day.

On screen copy:

Merrill Financial Solutions Advisor

Disclosure: Please see important information at the end of this video.

On screen copy:

Advise clients on their investment goals in order to pursue those goals

As a Merrill Financial Solutions Advisor, my job is to advise my clients on their investment goals and match them with the right portfolio and specialists to help them pursue those goals.

I interact with clients from all walks of life, from small-business owners developing a financial plan to new parents looking to start saving money for their child’s college education. I match my knowledge of financial markets and investment products with clients’ individual investment needs.

On screen copy:

Accomplishing performance goals through needs-based analysis and client follow-up

A key part of my role is accomplishing performance goals through consultative, needs-based analysis and organized follow up with my clients.

When I first started, I had a lot to learn about the investment world and compliance standards but I was equipped with the tools and training I needed to succeed.

On screen copy:

Team environment

In my last job, I worked mostly on my own. Here, I get to work in a team environment every day. I even get some of my best referrals from my teammates.

And since I work with people in so many different departments, I’m able to build connections and learn more about other roles.

Everyone here is really supportive of your career growth.

title: Financial Analyst
job_description: The Alaka`ina Foundation Family of Companies (FOCs) is looking for a Financial Analyst to support our Program Manager Training Systems (PM TRASYS) customer in Orlando, FL.DUTIES INCLUDE:* Accurately develop financial spend plans and formulate budgets. Input this data into CERBERUS and track variances to actuals within the system.* Accurately and timely report on and analyze Status of Funds and maintain financial checkbooks.* Develop and process funding packages for commitment of funds.* Analyze and process all incoming and outgoing funding documents. Funding packages shall be accurately and completely developed in accordance with the following guidance: (1) Department of Navy Financial Management Policy Manual, August 2018 (2) Deputy for Financial Management (DFM) Handbook (3) MCSC Order 4200.2C Command Procurement Request (PR) Process dated Sep 29 2009 (4) MARCORSYSCOM DFM Document Review Checklists (5) As expressly directed by, and in accordance with additional guidance provided by the Government.* Timely perform financial reconciliation and database research (to include Unliquidated Obligations (ULO)).* Manage and reconcile unliquidated obligations, commitments, obligations and disbursements using PowerPoint presentations, Excel spreadsheets, or Information papers on a daily basis, or as required and utilize various etools to include SABRS, PRBuilder, SMARTS, Wide Area Work Flow (WAWF), Electronic Document Access (EDA), Defense Travel System (DTS) for voucher status, NHS, CERBERUS and others as required to provide supporting documentation to these reports; and establish controls to maintain visibility of actions.* Research, reconcile and collect documentation for current, expired and canceling year transactions to assist the Government in completing the Triannual Review (TAR) on a triannual basis.* Review current and dormant records identified for the triannual period by the Managerial Accounting Office for review in accordance with the performance standards.* Accurately and timely assist the Government in the DoD Program Objective Memorandum (POM) development and submission process in accordance with all Command policies and guidance.* Assist the Government with the Navy Command and OSD Budget Estimate Submission processes and exhibits.* Assist the Government in the President's Budget submission process and exhibits.* Provide support to the development and execution of the overall PM TRASYS operating budget. Accurately complete development and execution tasks as directed by the Government in accordance with all Command policies and guidance.* Support the preparation of funding data for review. Accurately complete funding tasks as directed by the Government in accordance with all Command policies and guidance.* Prepare obligation and disbursement phasing plans. Accurately and completely prepare obligation and disbursement phasing plans as directed by the Government in accordance with all Command policies and guidance.* Prepare internal and external funding documents for Operations and Maintenance (OMMC), Procurement (PMC), and Research, Development, Test and Evaluation (RDT&E) appropriations in a multiple year environment and follow funding documents from origination to close out.* Review and research contract modifications, PR Builder funding documents, and other financial reports for un-liquidated obligation balances at least weekly. Load and maintain data regarding obligations for contracts, travel, training, awards, labor, MIPRs, PCSs and GBLs in various spreadsheets, and prepare management level reports and presentations on funding and budgets. Coordinate activities to complete customer requests for financial and funding data, to include assisting in estimating the cost of required activities and submit to the Government for final approval and transmission to the customer. Accurately and completely perform the required actions as directed by the Government in accordance with all Command policies and guidance.* Support the development and submission of various forms and reports including POM taskers and briefings (throughout the year), Program Management Review briefings (ordinarily quarterly), information papers, and impact statements, as required. The contractor shall accurately and completely support the required actions as directed by the Government in accordance with all Command policies and guidance.REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:* Apparent experience and skills in the areas of: Spend Plans, Unliquidated Obligations, commitments, obligations and disbursements.* Ability to perform work under minimal supervision.* Ability to handles complex issues and problems, and refer only the most complex issues to higher-level staff relating to internal and external funding activities.* Must possesses comprehensive knowledge of subject matter area.REQUIRED EDUCATION AND CERTIFICATIONS:* Bachelor's degree and 4+ years of experience desired. Work experience can substitute for degree(s).DESIRED SKILLS:* Prior experience supporting the DoD or a Federal agency.* Experience providing financial support where activities must follow guidelines associated with: (1) OMB Circular A-11 (2) DoD 7000.14-R Financial Management Regulation (3) Department of Navy Financial Management Policy Manual, August 2018 and (4) Department of Navy Budget Guidance Manual.CITIZENSHIP/CLEARANCE:* Must be a US Citizen.* Active Secret clearance desired.The Alaka`ina Foundation Family of Companies (FOCs) is comprised of industry-recognized government service firms who are designated as Native Hawaiian Organization (NHO)-Owned and fall into the respective categories of standard Small Business, 8(a) certified Small Disadvantaged Business (SDB), and HUBZone. The FOCs includes Ke`aki Technologies, Laulima Government Solutions, Kupono Government Services, Kapili Services, and Po`okela Solutions. Alaka`ina Foundation activities under the 501(c)3 principally benefit the youth of Hawaii through charitable efforts which includes providing innovative educational programs that combine leadership, science & technology, and environmental stewardship.For additional information on the Alaka`ina Foundation Family of Companies (FOCs), please visit www.alakainafoundation.com.We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer of individuals with disabilities and veterans. We are proud to state that we do not discriminate in employment decisions on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. If you are a person with a disability and you need an accommodation during the application process, please click here to request accommodation. We E-Verify all employees.#Monster

title: Financial Analyst
job_description:
Job Title: Financial Analyst

Date: June 2020

Location: Beverly Hills, CA

Full-Time/Part-Time: Full-Time

CIRE Equity is an entrepreneurial, growth-oriented company focused on the creation and preservation of wealth through targeted investments in commercial real estate in the Western United States.

We are passionate about real estate, dedicated to hard work and strive for excellence in everything that we do. We value our employees and aim to create a fun, merit-based environment that encourages hard work, creative thinking and high-quality performance. We foster persistent improvement, and we are seeking likeminded individuals who share our attention to detail and passion for excellence to join our growing team.

Description

CIRE Equity is seeking a Financial Analyst who will be responsible for all financial analysis needed to support its Acquisitions and Asset Management teams. This individual will be relied on to cover a wide swath of responsibilities ranging from financial modeling for new acquisitions to performance tracking and scenario analysis for existing portfolio assets. The position involves a high level of complexity with regard to financial modeling, financial analysis and the interpretation of agreements, including leases, CC&R’s and operating agreements, for the purpose of application to financial analysis and modeling. An ideal candidate will be proactive, will possess a strong attention to detail without compromising efficiency, and will be able to independently tackle and resolve complex issues in our fast-paced, ever changing environment.

Responsibilities:

Work closely within the Acquisitions team to perform ad-hoc financial analyses of prospective deals prior to offer submittal.
Preparation of Argus to generate cash flows and export/manipulation within Excel templates.
Create detailed financial models for new acquisitions under contract, including detailed cash flow pro forma and syndication waterfalls.
Assist in all aspects of the due diligence process for new acquisitions, including the review of leases and estoppels, review of CC&R’s, reconciliation of historical financial statements to pro forma, and reconciliation and analysis of operating expense reimbursements to ensure accurate underwriting of the deal and to identify opportunities to unlock value post-acquisition.
Track the financial performance of the existing portfolio on a quarterly basis including assisting in the management of quarterly appraisal process.
Assist in special situation fund tracking calculations on an investor level working with fund administrator.
Maintain property level financial models in real time to assist in portfolio strategy and decision making.
Provide analytical assistance to support asset managers with leasing, capital expenditure and disposition decisions.
Work with executive team to perform various strategic valuation and stress test analyses on existing portfolio assets.

Management Expectations:

Maintain a high level of accuracy in underwriting of acquisitions through attention to detail and a thorough review of due diligence materials.
Identify opportunities to enhance the revenue of new deals where existing agreements, such as leases and CC&R’s have been improperly implemented.
Efficiently and accurately perform complex, ad-hoc financial analyses, distill key indicators and present clear and concise summaries.
Proactively monitor the performance of all assets under management relative to pro forma and present findings to the executive team.

Competencies

Self-motivated, inquisitive and passionate.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
Highly analytical and able to maintain a positive approach to complicated financial tasks.
Able to solve problems and deal with a variety of variables in unique situations where only limited standardization exists.
Detail oriented and able to maintain a high quality of work under pressure.
Excellent grasp of real estate financial statements including profit and loss statements, balance sheets and cash flow statements.
Highly proficient in real estate finance with ability to analyze and model the full scope of a real estate transaction, including syndication waterfalls.
Ability to read and interpret legal documents such as commercial leases, CC&R’s, listing agreements, management agreements, loan agreements and service contracts.
Ability to multi-task and manage priorities against key deadlines within a fast-paced environment
Highly proficient in Microsoft Excel and Argus. MRI experience is a plus.

Position Requirements

Bachelor's degree required; preferred concentration in business or finance.
2+ years of experience in financial analysis, asset management, private equity or investment banking. Experience in commercial (retail, industrial, office) real estate preferred.

title: Financial Advisor

title: Financial Analyst
job_description:
Job DescriptionCustom Software Systems (CSS) Inc., is seeking a Financial Analyst and technical advisor. This role Independently performs a variety of evaluations and analyses regarding the eligibility and qualifications of client lenders. The candidate will evaluate lender performance on an ongoing basis to ensure risks to the client’s loan portfolio are reflected to management accurately, appropriately and in a timely manner. This position is to conduct lender oversight activities for all the client’s Lending partners and portfolio; and carry out policy, program and portfolio analysis of loan program portfolios.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Provide operational guidance and assistance to stakeholders (both internal and external)Provide guidance and direction to the Office of Credit Risk Management regarding the client’s policies and procedures relative to the Delegated Authority process and Desktop ReviewsDevelop and recommends to the Supervisory Financial Analyst procedural and policy changes and enhancementsProvide program oversight and administers management control systems and processes to ensure participants adhere to established policy and proceduresFormulates and recommends policies and procedures with respect to the client’s Delegated Authority and Desktop Review programPlans, coordinates, and initiates activities to complete the processing of Delegated Lender analysis and Desktop ReviewsDevelop evaluations and analyses of a lender’s eligibility to obtain or retain Delegated Authority through the assessment of qualitative and quantitative factorsConducts financial and statistical analyses and evaluations of lender performance and develop work papers and reports detailing the results of the financial analysesIdentifies operational weaknesses and deficiencies in the delivery of Delegated Authority and Desktop Reviews, formulates and recommends policies and procedures to improve those weaknesses, and implements enhancements to increase the program's efficiency and effectivenessOther administrative duties and responsibilities may be assigned or to assist with other Credit Risk Management functions.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Minimum of 8 years experienceComprehensive knowledge of concepts, principles, theories, and practices offinancial structure, credit risk, business management operations, liquidation issues, and SBA lending policies and procedures sufficient to serve as an expert in financing and in development of SOPs, procedures, and other types of formal instructionPractical knowledge of accounting and computer systems.Skillful in identifying which data are needed for program development, implementation, direction, management, monitoring and evaluation purposes. Identifying data, ability to develop these data and be able to systematically organize, collate and summarize these data into succinct, accurate and effective reports and charts for effective management oversight and program/lender/SBA office evaluation purposesAbility to make oral and written presentations clearly, concisely, and effectively.Develop work product, recommendations, and suggestions that are relied on as technically correct. Complicated work is reviewed for agreement with overall policies, attainment of objectives, and due datesUse resourcefulness and experienced judgment in devising new techniques, developing methods, or significantly departing from established practices, as required by unique conditions and the broad range of situations, practices, and operations. Substantial deviation from precedents is encouraged in order to development more effective methodsDevelop standards, methods, and procedures with respect to new programs and legislation affecting established programsAnalyze and isolate variables in order to identify individual factors and to interrelate and correlate financial and accounting variables and processes, as well as the underlying financial principals, in order to plan, develop, execute, and evaluate lender program requirements and to draw correct conclusions from the data evaluated. Frequently, the analyst must extend or adapt existing methodology due to shifting variables and the lack of specific guidance or precedentProvide expert technical experience and assistance in the conduct of special analyses and reviews of the client’s portfolios and lender oversight programs including delegation of authority. Evaluates portfolios on an ongoing basis to ensure risks to the loan portfolio are reflected accurately and appropriatelyPrepare analyses to identify current and emerging risks to client’s loan portfolio, and prepare reports for senior management to help understand riskRecommend delegation of authority, portfolio of lenders monitoring, and oversight, including scheduling lender renewals, reviews, analyzing results, identifying required actions and following-up to ensure completionReview reports and/or examinations reports prepared by contractors for quality assurance and regulatory compliance and issuance and for oversight, monitoring and supervisory purposesWorks with the contractor to ensure the monthly, quarterly, and annual deliverables are received by client in a timely fashion; reviews lenders federal and state regulators’ enforcement actions, formal/informal agreements, mergers and acquisitions; and review and revise the monthly and quarterly reportsEnsures lender’s lending activities and regulatory issues comply with rules prescribed under the standard operating procedures for each program.

EDUCATION:

Bachelor’s degree or higher from an accredited institution

Company DescriptionCompany Background:

Headquartered in Leesburg, Virginia, Custom Software Systems, Inc. (CSS) is a Woman-Owned (WOSB) and HUBZone certified small business. Built on a foundation of trusted client partnerships, CSS has fostered a stakeholder-centric yet disciplined approach to IT solutions development. This ensures our ability to consistently meet or exceed our customers' expectations.

Benefits:

CSS is a very employee oriented company knowing that well trained, professional associates are what make our company great. We offer a competitive benefits package that includes: paid holidays and paid time off; medical insurance that includes vision; dental insurance; company paid long and short-term disability and life insurance; a Simple IRA plan (similar to 401k); parking and commuter reimbursement. We also work with our employees on training and professional certification plans that benefit the employee, the client and CSS - a win-win-win strategy.

Equal Opportunity Employer:

CSS provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. CSS complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

CSS expressly prohibits any form of unlawful employee harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of CSS employees to perform their expected job duties is absolutely not tolerated.
